text: Wonderful dinner place! Delicious food great outdoor seating, good service. Definitely recommend!

The garlic knots are so delicious!! Clams with linguine lacked luster, but the pizzas were pretty good. I like the atmosphere and the convenient location. There is a cute outdoor patio and paper table covers so you could color/draw during your meal; I thought that was a nice touch. Seriously though, I must repeat myself, the garlic knots are pretty insane.

My family decided to eat out this Sunday. We yelped Italian restaurants and saw the four stars so decided to give it a try. The restaurant was clean and the staff were attentive.  The restaurant was not busy(maybe a third full). The food had little to be desired.  The food was no better than the popular Italian chain--they even use the same boxed pasta! We started with calamari which were rubbery and greasy and served with an odd colored "red" sauce that was actually orange. I had tortellini with Alfredo sauce which was melted butter mixed with cream and very watery. No herbs or flavor whatsoever.  The tortellini was not house made and over cooked to boot! They were happy to take my tortellini and remake something else but after eating a stick of watery butter from my first bite, I lost my appetite.  My husband ordered veal parmigiana but the waiter brought some odd fried meat with a salad on the top!  Oops. My son ordered chicken parmigiana.  He said it was ok. We were out for a family meal and my son ended up eating alone while my husband and I watched.  Right about the time my son finished eating his meal my husbands actual order came so we got to watch him eat.  Not exactly the family dinner we had in mind.  Very pricey for "chain" quality food.  I would not recommend this restaurant.

This is a nice Italian restaurant in Downtown Sumerlin. I have eaten here at least 6 times since they opened. Sometimes it's just me and my wife, and other times with our (grown) kids.
When it's just the two of us, we usually start with the calamari. I'm not a big fan of calamari, but at this restaurant, I make an exception. I've tried the calamari at Red Lobster, and thought I was chewing a pencil eraser. The calamari here was better than any other I have tried. I actually finished the large portion (I did have help from my wife).  If we go with the kids, we will oder the antipasto platter. Yes, it is pricey, but it's a generous size, and the quality of the meats is first rate. I'm pretty sure the prosciutto is imported from Italy.

  For my main course, I seem to be stuck on the salmon. I really like their spaghetti with meat sauce, and the veal parm is awesome, but the salmon does it for me.  It is always tender, juicy, and flavorful.  It even tastes good the next day for lunch, when I can't finish it at the restaurant because I ate too much calamari or antipasto.  Oh yeah, if you have room, the carrot cake is awesome. Get three or four friends to help you finish it.
 
 I see in a couple of reviews people were complaining about slow service. In all the times I've been here, I have not had that experience.  The staff was very friendly, and the service was professional.  Obviously if the joint was jumping, like on a Friday or Saturday night, it takes a little longer for food to arrive, but that's how it is at any busy restaurant. 

  Do yourself a favor, next time you have a taste for Italian food, and you're near Summerlin, check out this place.  They have indoor, and covered outdoor seating.  It's a great location to "people watch" while you are enjoying a drink and a great meal.

My husband and I were vacationing in Vegas and our friends said don't leave Vegas without going to Trattoria Reggiano.  We trust them so off we went for lunch today.  Our waitress, Ricki was so friendly and helpful  we asked for her recommendation.  I had soup and my husband had lobster ravioli. OMG food was fantastic but Ricki made our meal extra special.  Besides being helpful with our food choices she is friendly and never got annoyed with our numerous questions.  When we were ready to leave we hugged Ricki, by then we felt like she was family.  We will recommend this restaurant to everyone who goes to Vegas and it is a must to have Ricki as their server.  We will be back.  Ricki is a definite asset to this business and deserves kudos.

I prefer other foods than Italian. Pizza is pretty much the most Italian I'll ever eat. I thought pizza is oh well another pizza
 But oh no !!!. The pizza I had was outstanding   It's the Quattro Stagioni. Ummm. Yummy.  Ingredients were fresh. Crust perfect.  Our waiter Wyatt  (and no his last name is not Earp) was very attentive. Overall, am visiting AGAIN !!!  
Grace & Pete

I went here for dinner tonight with my son, and I must say I was not pleased. I ordered gluten free pasta with chicken and no butter. The waiter said that the chicken was going to be dry. I said that I would rather have it be dry than to get sick from all the oil and dairy. When the food came, I was surprised to find out that my chicken was breaded. I don't understand why they would give me breaded chicken with gluten free pasta. The waiter never came back after that, so I tried to take off the bread unsuccessfully and ended up giving the rest of my chicken to my son. He got the linguine with shrimp pasta with a watered down sauce that he said was disgusting. $85 later, I feel like I was robbed and have a stomach ache. I wonder if that pasta was really gluten free. My recommendation is that you don't go here and go to the many other places around.

I have found heaven on earth.  There are not enough adjectives to describe the amazing meal my friend and I had last night.  If you are looking for a TASTY gluten free pizza look no further. I have tried endless gluten free choices for pizza and this was by far the BEST I've ever had!   We also had the filet mignon meatballs which were RIDICULOUS and the eggplant rollatini melted in your mouth.  Finally an Italian place in Summerlin that brings you back to New York Italian.  Yummmm!  Can't wait to go back and try more.  My neighbor was eating penne Alla vodka and RAVED about it so that is next!   Oh and did I mention the staff was friendly and service was thumbs up!   Located right next to movie theatre in downtown Summerlin! Thank you Trattoria!!

This was our first time dining here and we were impressed with the service. Everyone was very friendly and efficient and they took excellent care of us even though it was a busy evening. The calamari was excellent. The baked clams were very good. The Caesar salad was good as was the lasagne. The lobster ravioli was the only thing that didn't live up to its billing. All and all it was a nice evening and if you are in the mood for Italian it is worth trying.

No wait on a Sunday afternoon.  Expect to wait if you go on Friday or Saturday night (I tried once before and was told 1 hour wait .... no thanks).  Great selection of Italian dishes.  I had the lobster ravioli and wife had the linguini and claims.  Both were very good.   The flavors were very authentic. Lots of claims.  Also had the espresso martini that was well prepared (not too strong on the alcohol and a good espresso flavor)

Another big thing with this restaurant are the complementary garlic knots.  They are great.  They have olive oil and vinegar on the table, but some butter might also be nice.  Also, when we got our first batch, they were very cold and I mentioned this to the waitress who said "Ohh, they just came out.  So do you want a new one?"  Yeah, right -- they just came out (15 minutes ago).  Nice try.  The correct response is -- "I'm sorry, I'll get you a fresh batch right away."  But they were replaced with a hot fresh batch about 3 minutes later.

In fact, if I had any complaint, I would say that our server was not the most attentive (took a while to bring drinks, took a while to bring the bread, the aforementioned breach comment).  The other complaint was the prices -- almost $70 for lunch for two with no dessert and one martini drink (including tip).  A bit pricey, but this is appears to be the new norm in the bourgeois downtown Summerlin area, so I guess its to be expected.  

The dessert tray looked good (and I would like to try the TIramisu) but I was full so will have to be next time.  Anyway, I will definitely go back and try out some other things.

My family keeps coming back to this wonderful restaurant.   Vito is the best host.  The food is  top notch made from quality 
ingredients.  Generous servings.  Excellent service.  Very comfortable  setting.

The worst, over priced, and the kind of service that belongs at a truck stop. Was man handled by a waiter with a attitude like he just caught his wife in bed with his brother. Ordered baked clams that were thrown on the table as was the rest of the dishes like a set of dice and tasted like oiled bread. The shrimp scampi was so salty I drank a gallon of water over a two hour period. The shrimp was hard, rubbery, and chewy. Dropped a $100 bill on that miserable experience. BEWARE !!!

Absolutely love this restaurant. The food and ambiance are fantastic! We usually eat at the bar, No need to even look at a drink menu...we just ask Eli to make us something delicious...and he always comes through with an amazing concoction!!!!!

What a great dining experience. Came here with my family for lunch. The food was amazing. The appetizers mussels, calamari and eggplant rollatini were delicious. Chicken franchise was cooked to perfection. The desserts tiramisu, cannolis and chocolate cake were unbelievable. Our waiter Giovanni was the best. If you are looking for great Italian food and a warm and inviting place to dine I highly recommend you try this place.

The reason we went it was because the waiter was friendly and allowing my dog to sit with us outside.  We ordered pizza, it came out buried,  the garlic knots  were  too greasy for us..  The coffee were like hot water, no coffee taste at all. The spaghetti with meatball is nothing to get excited.  The only thing good about this is allowing my dog to sat with us.
2.5/5.  Atmosphere was great, bread was DELISH, service was abysmal.  I couldn't hate on the entrée though but our meal was over $100.  Good experience but not worth going back to.
After a reply from restaurant, I decided to give them another try.  Last night had a very enjoyable dinner.  The food was very good and they have a great kids menu. I will definitely eat here again

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place last night,July 26 for our anniversary since we live close by and both love Italian food. We went in at around 8:45 and were seated immediately and were told that they close at 10- which is fine. 

Our night quickly turned when we met our waitress. She was extremely rude and was reluctant to answer any of our questions. When I asked "what is the difference between a small Caesar salad and a large?" She rolled her eyes and said a small is a small and a large is a large."As if we didn't already know that. So then I asked another question, "is a small salad enough for two people to share?" To which she replied, "it depends on your appetite." ABSOLUTELY NO HELP AT ALL. So we ordered the small Caesar to share and the portion was so small my boyfriend just told me to have it. After this our waitress didn't check in at our table one time. She walked past and would say "is everything ok?" But wouldn't even stop walking to hear our answers. 
This type of behavior would be somewhat understandable if they were busy but we were one of only three tables in the restaurant! 

I could go on and on about how rude our waitress was but I think that about sums it up. I will say this however, at the end of our meal when we asked for boxes, she boxed up my boyfriends food and I boxed up my own, which I didn't mind. My boyfriend took his left over baked ziti with meatballs to work with him today and guess what? The waitress didn't put the meatballs in the to go container. 
After paying the high prices of the entrees and wanting to take some home one would assume you would get everything you paid for in the to go container but apparently not. 
 
We went here to celebrate what should have been a great night, but our service was so poor, half way through the meal both of us were upset. 

I am in the food industry as a waitress and I usually don't write yelp reviews like this but this was the WORST dining experience I have ever had in my life. 

I did give two stars however because the food was good, and the hostess and busser staff were very friendly. But our experience was so sour we will never be back.
Had the Shrimp Scampi and loved it!  Great environment and the staff was wonderful. Definitely worth checking out!

Hello,

People like Hilda, Danny(Server) Tony, and Manager Daniel G. are and will always be your greatest asset. Their abilities and contributions are an important key to the success of your entire operation. Take a moment to reflect upon your teams accomplishments and take pride in knowing that your people are an intricate reason of success to this restaurant. As I will continue to eat here, it is greatly appreciated how well we are always taken care of, and always have a great experience. Let this not go unnoticed, but let them know how well there service continues to bring us back to this restaurant. Of course the food is great, but the service Ashley and myself are given is even GREATER! I am having family from out of town as I graduate the Police Academy for Metro, I look forward to them eating here. I strongly encourage this letter be seen by your team! Keep up the great work, and see you soon. 

Thank you again for your loyal support.

Ashley, & Lance.

I just finished reading a review of an incident at this restaurant on 8/10/15 written by someone patting himself on the back and being untruthful about what happened.  My family and I eat here quite often.  We love the food and the service.  I don't know what place the writer was in but this restaurant doesn't have 15 people working on any shift.  When the lady fell, the bartender (who was an EMT) immediately rushed to her.  At the same time, one of the servers was doing exactly what she should by calling mall security.  The "gentleman" really didn't have to do anything since the staff was very knowledgeable about the appropriate actions to take and took them. 

I very seldom write anything on Yelp, but I do read reviews of places we want to try.  It really bothers me when someone writes inaccurate reviews.  That is not to say that things can't be wrong at times with food and service. However, let's at least be honest.

The food at this restaurant is not New York Italian, but rather, true Italian from Italy.  It is authentic and excellent.  The servers, bartenders, and manager are always helpful, polite, and accommodating.  

I have tried to correct an injustice by explaining the event and stating our enjoyment every time we dine here.

I'd give 3.5 if available, but I'm feeling generous so I'll round up.  

4 of us went for a Saturday night dinner.  We had reservations for 7:30 and they seated us immediately.  Restaurant was clean, staff was about as friendly as you could reasonably expect with a packed house on a hot Vegas night.  
Here are a few, admittedly minor, critiques. - our waiter was an older gentleman, with a thick, we thought possibly added on and emphasized for 'authenticity' accent.  He clearly struggled with the whole placing the order via iPad thing, especially when one in the party ordered something he wasn't familiar with (but was on the menu and no changes were requested).  - The pasta e fagioli was certainly nothing to remember, which is disappointing with the 'we're in DTS so we can overcharge' pricepoint on all the dishes. - and one of my pet peeves, they didn't bring all the entrees out at the same time.  They brought three and one in the party had to wait for a while until theirs arrived.  

Not sure if I'll go back.  Food was solid (save the soup), but the price was rather high for what you get and there are better Italian options in town.

First time here and had a wonderful experience. We sat at the bar and Bethany was our bartender. Service was spot on. We started with a couple glasses of red wine recommended by Bethany. They were exactly what we were looking for.
We only wanted an appetizer to share and Bethany recommended the meatballs. This was a good choice as the meat was flavorful and the pomodoro sauce was divine.
At 7pm the live music started and it was a great touch. Hi quality lounge music I would call it. 
Great food, great service, great atmosphere.
We'll be back soon!

Trattoria Reggiano must have taken note of my critical review. In my three times being back at this establishment since my less than exceptional first experience, I have found that the service, food, and ambiance has improved tremendously. This location has gone from one that I nearly disdained, to one that I recommend to colleagues without hesitation. The unprecedented turnaround that this fantastic restaurant underwent is nothing short of astounding, and I look forward to enjoying the impressive Trattoria Reggiano for a long time. 

(P.S.) My Reccomendations:

1st Course: Calamari
2nd Course: Chicken Francese or Veal Milanese 
3rd Course: Tiramasu
My first time here, food was delicious! I recommend this place, if you want real Italian food. Love it...

omg..this place is awesome ..great food .entertainment...
Betheny the bartender ...is frickin awesome...love this place .
Great place to stop for a drink while shopping. Food was great. Ricki was AWESOME!!! Best service I've had in Vegas so far. I would definitely recommend this place. Ask for Ricki
First time here and we love it. Food was great. I had the gnocchi with Alfredo and side of meatballs. Sam was our waiter and offered great service with a touch of good humor. We will come back.
Eli is the best bartender in Summerlin. Creative, inventive, and gracious.  Have him create a berry grappa martini or a chocolate espresso martini for a sumptuous beginning and end. Going back soon.

Great food and great service by great people. 
Definitely a must to dine in at Downtown Summerlin.
Our server, Giovanni, was delightful. The food was great! I had the chicken parm and spaghetti. Also had the chocolate cake, the cake was very good also.

Pizza and wine...the rest was fine. That pretty much sums up our experience. We sat at the bar and despite it not being crowded, waited quite a long time before we were acknowledged by the bartender and even then had to wait longer for him to take our order...which came out half wrong. Another couple was also waiting at the bar and ended up leaving because the bartender never helped them. 

The pizza was very good and I would come back for it but I do hope the service improves.

We stopped in here for a glass of wine before our movie. We ended up having 4 glasses total, two of which were on happy hour. I will preface this by saying that I did not look specifically at the prices of the wine or the specifics of the happy hour specials. Our bill came to $60! Needless to say I was shocked. I could have gotten 4 bottles (of the same wine) at Costco for that price!! I really do love the atmosphere and have enjoyed their food in the past.  I would go back but definitely recommend checking out a corking fee or have your wine before you go!  The manager stated the pricing is related to the night rental on retail space at this complex.
Great Veal Parm and Eggplant! Service was fantastic ! Only thing I don't like is the seating is a little too close together , otherwise it was delicious real Italian food!
Great place, great service and authentic Italian fare. The fresh bread is outta site!!

I have eaten at Trattoria Reggiano at the Venetian before. Staying in Summerlin, we chose to go to the new restaurant in Summerlin and (finally) found the restaurant in the new shopping mall "Downtown Summerlin". Good food, not cheap, but certainly a place to go back to. What made the evening complete and why we give this 5 stars was Danny, the waiter, who really did everything to make this perfect. From asking the chef to make some changes to a plate without butter but olive oil instead to giving recommendations and helping to clear the table. Great ! Keep this attitude Danny ! Fantastic.

The food is very good quality and the staff is very happy to accommodate particular requests.  The atmosphere is very nice with nice outdoor terrace seating available.  There is enjoyable live singing entertainment after 7 PM.  I like that it is open at those odd hours between lunch and dinner.  My only complaint-- they don't have dark field green lettuce; if they did, I'd give it 5 stars.

We ate here for the first time this evening and was not disappointed. The calamari was very good and crispy just the way I like it. The Caesar's salad was bold and tasty. I had the chicken parmigiana. It was tender and juicy. The marinara sauce was thick and with just the right amount of flavor. My wife had the margarita pizza. She said it was very tasty as well. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice atmosphere and good food the the price.

Just one meal here and I am now a super fan! 
I already can't wait for my next trip to Vegas!!! I just want to eat here.  

If I knew I was to die tomorrow, my last meal would be their pizza and garlic bread!  My husband, who is very finicky, LOVED his pasta! 

Lastly, the service is impeccable!  It's the Nordstrom of restaurants, they want to make you happy and take great care to give you nothing less than amazing service! 

The ambiance is great and it doesn't make you feel like you're in Las Vegas.
Outstanding! Must see Eli at the bar. Amazing appetizers, salad, main course!!! Eli's wine selection was superb!! Bringing friends back here soon...

BETTER THAN EVER!
I think I ate there 20 times this year! 
Bethany and the entire crew (including managers)
make the experience fantastic!!!!
By far my favorite Italian place. Bethany at the bar is the best!  Great service and fantastic food. Highly recommended!!!

The food was good,however the place was understaffed.The server really didnt know italian food or wine.We asked several questions about the wine list and nobody could properly answer them.If you work in an Italian restraunt you really should know the difference between chianti and barolo.Surprised they dont hire more experienced serversll

Came here with my boyfriend last night and we had a great experience! Everyone was very nice, service was fast and friendly. We had the calamari to share and it was really good. I got the carbonara and my boyfriend got the linguine in clams. Everything was very good, will definitely come back soon for another date!

Located in Downtown Summerlin next to the movie theatre, I strolled in here late last Sunday night. There's a lot of options for Italian in downtown Summerlin, but I was curious to try this place out after walking past it so many times- I'm glad I did. I tried the Chicken Parmesan and pepperoni pizza, so delicious! Their marinara had excellent flavor and they immediately give you garlic knots upon sitting down, (mouthwatering) but be careful not to get full before your food comes! Portions are on the larger side and the restaurant is nice but not elegant, perfect for just a casual date night or dinner with family. Also, friendly staff! I was one of the last tables and didn't feel rushed at all.

We went on a busy night during the holiday season but were able to make a reservation for two anyway. They were nice about accommodating. I thought the food here was surprisingly good. I had shrimp scampi and my husband had swordfish. Both were very flavorful and nicely prepared. The service was very good albeit a bit slow (not over the top great, but still good). The ambiance is just okay....we were seated inside and it's very cramped (indoor dining area is really small). Overall, a tasty meal. I would go back again for the food.
Love this place, especially the bread. Bethany is the best bartender and we will keep coming back often as long as she's there

I decided to try this place out for a late Sunday dinner. The outside seating was cozy and the weather was perfect. The bread served before dinner was amazing! The server called it bread but it was delicious garlic knots. Calamari also amazing as an appetizer and finished up with a bruschetta pizza.  It was all plenty of food to share for 2.

Always amazing, we are now long time repeat customers for years to come. Authentic Italian is hard to find. Super fresh food, great atmosphere in downtown summerlin, great staff. Love it! Can't go wrong with the Filet meatballs, calamari is so fresh-you can see them cutting it there, the CANNOLI and chocolate cake TO DIE FOR! Yum.
Food is very good. Service was excellent. I went with a group of 6 on two different occasions and it was excellent both times. Definitely worth a try.

Trattoria Reggiano is a great local Summerlin Italian restaurant for causal alfresco dinning. Our bartender and cocktails were fantastic! I love that they allow you to bring your own bottles of wine (for a small pour fee) adds a fun personal touch to the dinning experience. The appetizers and entrées all around the table were on point, well seasoned, excellent portion size and absolutely delicious! This place will definitely be our go-to when in the mood for Italian!

This restaurant just opened today! Service was excellent!! My wife is pregnant and not able to have bleu cheese. The item she ordered had some crumbled on top. Ben took ownership and insisted on remaking the dish without it. After my wife was cool enough to say she would just pick it off, Ben insisted and had the dish remade. Wonderful staff, great food, and most importantly to me great service. We highly recommend this new spot at DT Summerlin, we will for sure be coming back!

The 4 star rating is for the food, service was more of a mixed bag.  But, let's start with the positive.  The food was spot on and really nice for a casual, relaxed neighborhood place.  The garlic rolls are some of the best I've had in town.  For some reason, most of the garlic knots I've tried here in Vegas have not been up to par.  These are the exception.  They're soft and have that stretch and bounce of a good knot, garlicky with olive oil and a sprinkle of Parmesanm and served with extra bottles of olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  Margarita pizza with burrata was excellent, Caesar salad was tasty with dressing on the vinegary side, kids meals were decent and each meal came with a mini cannoli for dessert.  Meatballs looked great but didn't try. I would absolutely come back for the food.

Ok, here's the scoop on the service.  I think we just had an overworked server that day and that person was not at their best.  I prefer to give them the benefit of e doubt bc we all have our bad days.  Suffice it to say, service and attitude were subpar but not enough to complain to management.   In the end, we just wanted to pay our bill and move along.  The hostess and manager were very nice and courteous and greeted everyone at the door.

Conclusion:  food's great but the waitstaff could use a bit more training.  We'll be back to try again.

My husband and I had a great time here. We came here on a rare, childless Thursday night and had a wonderful meal. We ordered the eggplant rollatini to start, which was wonderful. We were pleasantly surprised when they brought out garlic knots as their bread and an amuse bouche of Parmesan hunks, olives and roasted red pepper slices. I had to deliberately not fill up before my entree came out. I ordered the tortelloni and they were perfection. Delicate, flavorful perfection. I speculate that they hand make them because of how well they were cooked. My husband had the gnocchi and he thoroughly enjoyed that dish. We will definitely be back. I look forward to bringing my 8 year old foodie next time.

The over all taste of the food was very good.  Lobster Ravioli and Bucatini with garlic knots. Our order was a to go order.  First call had to hang up and call back into place my order because the guy didn't know the menu.  Second call the young lady was on point.  We will be going back to try more items on the menu. I approve this message J K KUHL..

First off props to the awesome busser Donald! He is the only reason we had any kind of decent service. He is treated so bad by the server Ricki and it's sad to see someone work so hard for someone so rude. 


We had a party of nine and from the beginning server Ricki was helping the hostess seat us. They were both annoyed and we just seemed to be an "inconvenience" to them. After we sat down Ricki was our server, and she asked what we wanted to drink. She offered alcohol we said no alcohol. She stated that she didn't ask if we wanted it. Okay well whatever than. After she bossed her busser to get drinks she took our order and we asked for bread please. She stated "once your food order goes in than you will get bread, you will have to wait". The whole time she was treating her busser like he was a slave. 

She got our pizza wrong. The food was okay. Nothing to rave about. 

We couldn't get her attention for anything she was to busy hanging out at the hostess stand talking and chatting. On the way out I told a manager about the experience and Ricki had the nerve to come chase us down in the walkway to the stores in downtown summerlin to tell us she didn't have an attitude and we were wrong. Talk about uncomfortable and so awful! Horrible customer service. We won't be returning! :(

Came in earlier this week with some girl friends for lunch. We were seated right away at a great table. Our waitress came very quickly and made some great recommendations . I remember her name as Ricky. Short blonde hair. Our food came in a timely manner and everything was superb. 
My friends and I have decided to make this place our new regular meetup place. Great food. Excellent staff. And loved the atmosphere.

Delicious italian dinner.  We had the Filet of Sole Meuniere.  Nice friendly atmosphere.  Live music on the patio.  Very personal staff.  Ask for Sam he is awesome. Great place to relax and enjoy at the Downtown Summerlin mall.

AWFUL!!

The only thing worse than the service is the food. Overpriced bland food served by staff who would rather shoot the breeze with each other than actually wait tables. 

Because of the poor service, I left a small tip (I probably should have given nothing) and believe it or not, when I checked my credit card statement I noticed that the amount had been changed. I called the restaurant and after investigating, they confirmed that the waiter had actually crossed out the amount of the tip and written in another amount! Blatant theft and credit card fraud!

If you go (which I wouldn't recommend), pay with cash.

Located in downtown Summerlin..has plenty of parking. Came here for an early dinner and was very pleased. You can sit either inside or out...we sat outside because it was perfect temp out at the time. We were greeted by a friendly hostess with a smile. We were immediately seated and brought water and a complimentary plate of olives, cheese and roasted peppers. Very tasty! 

After we ordered we were given the best garlic knots I ever had!! Warm, lightly salted and moist. So delicious we asked for more! Perfect to dip in the wonderful balsamic vinegar and olive oil. 

We started with the arugula salad. The dressing is light and tasty. We ordered the large size and they split it for us. We really appreciate that type of service. We also ordered the ziti pasta with meatballs. The meatballs are made with filet and pork. The dish comes with 2 huge delicious meatballs. The pasta is covered in a creamy and cheesy sauce. The dish is huge and we all took some home. I recommend you split this dish..as it's very filling.
The service is excellent, the food is delicious! I will be back!!

I cannot begin to tell you how disappointed I am with the food at this restaurant. Our waiter was excellent! He always kept our drinks full and our table attended to. Unfortunately, the food was crap. The pictures of the bread looked soooo good on other reviews - I had such high hopes! But, alas, the bread was rock hard and nigh flavorless (more pretzel like). The pasta, I kid you not, tasted EXACTLY like Chef Boyardee ravioli. We will not be going back. Macaroni Grill beats this place by miles.
Beautiful restaurant; food is good so was service however the crowd is 50+ especially at the bar.

Worst service- be prepared to lose your appetite from the frustration!  Asked on three separate occasions to three separate folks for oil and vinegar- got it on fourth try .  Manager offered to comp the bill- I refused !  This high potential restaurant need serious training/corporate attention- it's on a rough start- sorry!

Here on a quiet Wednesday evening with nice weather so we are enjoying it. It's our first time here and we like it. The pizza was great and the calamari was... Good but not exceptional. 

The manager Vito is great.

My favorite Italian restaurant in Summerlin. Great food, great atmosphere. The only complaint I have is the limited bar selection. They carry a good selection of wines and they have your basic hard liquor. I'm a Scotch guy, and I REALLY wished they served Balvenie 14 year Caribbean Cast.

Out of all the restaurants in downtown Summerlin this is by far my favorite! 

Offers both indoor and outdoor seating. Very Italian and fun atmosphere. 

For starters I think the kale salad is exceptional. I don't usually like kale but in this form it is delicious. Chicken Parmesan, gnocchi and baked ziti are among some of the entrees I have tried and all are very good! (My favorite being the gnocchi). 

Canoli's are also excellent!

I recommend this place if you are ever in down town Summerlin. I will continue to return. :)

Amazing place for lunch service, a good wine selection to compliment most meals. It did take a while to get food but everything seemed like it was made when ordered, with quality ingredients. The portions are very generous, as they should be to meet the higher than average prices.

What a disappointment, I was really looking forward to trying this place. All the great reviews for mediocre type of Italian food. It was like eating at an expensive version of an olive garden with the same crappie food. Don't know if maybe it was the wrong time or what but I definitely expected a lot more out of it. (Came around 2:30pm) The price is never an issue for me as long as you give great quality food and authentic...none of that here.

Another amazing meal at this fine italian restaurant. It was a birthday celebration and we had a group of 5. The server was very nice and attentive and provided great recommendations. The kale peanut salad is so amazing. The large portion is plenty for sharing. Also, the server recommened i add shrimp to the pesto gnocchi and it paired perfectly. Everyone at the table tried it and agreed it was a great choice. The pesto sauce is very good and the portion size is large. The garlic knots are to die for. The espresso drinks are made on a fine imported italian machine. Pairs perfectly with a cannoli or chocolate cake. There was great live music and the performer even sang happy brithday to our mother. The atmosphere is very inviting and everything on the menu is delicious! What more can yoh ask for?

This place is always packed for dinner when I've been. I hope they open a bigger location at some point to accomodate more patrons because the food is so darn good!

3.5 Stars but I always round up in the businesses favor. I called in my order and Ricki answered. She stated she would need to put me on hold cause she was way too busy to help me. Umm ok. I'd rather the business pick up and say "thank you for calling xxxx Can we place you on a short hold??" Not say we are too busy to help you. Anyways, I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. 

After I place my order for the Margherita con Burrata pizza, I was told 10 minutes. I arrive after about 12 minutes and am greeted by Ricki, who happens to be the waitress. She's serving multiple tables and answering phone calls?? Come on, are you serious? Now I understand why she told me she's too busy to help me. So I sit at the bar and wait about 10 more minutes for my pizza. I ask for red pepper and she tells me "if you want some I would have to go next door and get it" (next door is also their business). I just felt like she didn't care. 

Thankfully the pizza was delicious and I care more about the food then the service. I'll be back, just hope for a better interaction.

Excellent food but very poor service. For the prices I expected a higher level of service. I felt like I was at a cafe style, rather than a resturant. They are very slow and others seemed to feel the same.

Went here for lunch and sat in the outdoor area. The food and wine were great, and the complimentary garlic knots were HUGE. Pricing is the only thing that kept me from rating this place higher. Some of the basic pasta dishes are a bit pricey, but it IS Downtown Summerlin, so it was kind of expected.

I've eaten here twice. Both times I've gotten great service and the food is delicious. They bring out complimentary garlic bread and it's so good! We ordered calamari (crispy, fresh, delicious), gnocchi with bolognese sauce (my favorite and perfectly cooked) and hubby had linguine with clam sauce (he said it was great). Great decor, ambiance and location! (next to movie theater and close to parking) Food is a bit pricey for what it is but I don't mind it being a special night out.

Came here for a late dinner with the family after shopping. Very nice ambiance, live entertainment. The service is superb! Ordered a pizza which was suppose to come with ricotta, i appreciated that they handled the situation very professionally. Regardless of the missing ricotta on the pizza they quickly made us a new one to go & we still left as satisfied customers. The only con I had was the price, it was pretty pricey for what it was.

Food is a 10!! Our server, Domenico, was okay, but a little strange. Again, our pizza, arugula salad, and eggplant rollatinis were AMAZING, but watching Domenico touch our leftovers with his fingers while putting them into a to-go box was tough. Two stars off for that grossness. We intended to leave a $15 tip on a $53 bill, but took back $5 once we saw our food get manhandled.

I think we will be ordering from Uber Eats from now on instead of dining in.

I have eaten at this locally owned Italian restaurant four times since October.  My husband's family is Italian and the food here is like eating at Nannie's Sunday dinner.  The Veal Piccata is amazing.

I was unimpressed. The service was disinterested. The food was average. My husband ordered gluten free pasta, but we're fairly sure he was not given gluten free pasta because he was ill afterwards and we were not charged the additional *$5.00* when the bill arrived. If you are gluten free whether by choice or by necessity, be sure to check.

My husband is quite Italian and quite picky when it comes to food!! Trattoria is our "stop before the movies" in downtown Summerlin mall. Easy to get to, simply valet at the movies and a few steps your there! Indoor/Outdoor concept and super during this time of year.

Bar is extensive, food has always been amazing and seems like employees love it here because we see the same ole faces :)

Stop by and I would recommend the blackened Ceaser salmon salad for those counting calories + a glass of merlot.

Fun Fact: Did you know the dough for their pizzas are imported from New York!
The best gluten free pizza in town. You can sit outside on the patio, sometimes they have live music  the servers especially Britt knows her craft!!! Bravo

Had a friend in town and we wanted to go someplace different.  So since she was staying at Red Rock so we chose italian.  Truly great food, good wine selection and a very cool spot with indoor and outdoor seating.  Great service too.  Definitely will go back.

In the mood for Italian food before seeing a show. We decided to try Trattoria Reggiano in Downtown Summerlin. The ambience he's quite nice. You can choose between eating Outdoors on the patio or inside. Both good options. The service was excellent. The complimentary garlic knots  that they serve  at the beginning of the meal  a truly outstanding . Unfortunately the rest of the food did not rise to that level. For my entree I chose the chicken marsala. It comes with a side of pasta. The chicken was chewy and the flavor blah. My wife went with the meatball baked ziti. Also very mediocre. My buddy order the lasagna. He had difficulty eating it and rated it as poor at best. I gave it three stars rather than less because of the garlic knots and the outstanding service period but I certainly would not return here when there were so many other options for good quality Italian food in the area.

Delicious! I really enjoyed this place and the service! The manager came over to our table during one visit to check in with us and was extremely attentive and friendly. I could go back every night just for the garlic knots. I've never had the pizza here but can tell you the pasta meals and appetizers (chicken parm and marsala and the fried calamari) are amazing! Not a large wine selection unless you buy by the bottle which is a bummer for me, but still worth the trip! WOULD LOVEEEE gift cards available for here... especially with the holidays coming up. Also would LOVE a to go menu. With gift cards and to go menus, this place would be that much more amazing. Gift cards please!! :)

Wow ! Had dinner there again last night .
The bar was hoping and the drinks were flowing .
Jennifer the bartender followed me around the bar and offered me a drink when there were no seats . 
They've added live music and added several new dishes .
My wife had the Dover sole and I had the veal Milanese . 
Both were generous portions and excellent.
Highly recommended !!!

Just an update to my previous review .
We visited this establishment again this week and probably had the best eggplant appetizer .
Perfectly cooked covered in delicious red gravy and cheese .
Mmm
Best of all was the service , ambiance and of course the prices . 
It's the most authentic Italian restaurant in town .

What an amazing place. Spectacular Italian food. Chicken Parm and Cheese Ravoili is our go to dinner. Wendy the GM is a dream and treats you like family. Bethany tends bar and is the sweetest person we have met since moving to Las Vegas. Always friendly and goes out of her way to make every visit the best part of the day

I have dined at this restaurant a few times now. I have always been very satisfied. The food is absolutely scrumptious and cooked to perfection. My favorites are the meatballs, rollatini, and any of the seafood dishes. Whether dining with my wife or with friends Trattoria Reggiano is an excellent choice.

My husband and I dined here on Saturday night. We were visiting from out of town and staying at a nearby resort. We wanted Italian, but wanted to get out of the hotel. This place was close and had some good reviews. We are so glad that we decided to eat here!!

Our server was fantastic. The receipt said "Dominico" but I forgot to look at his name tag. Anyway, he was an older gentleman with an accent. He made great recommendations and steered us exactly where we wanted to go. We ended up ordering the Italian Kale salad to start and let me tell you....it was amazing! Then we got the Lobster Ravioli for our main course and it was fantastic as well. We were both very impressed. There was also live music and it was perfect.

We only make it to Vegas about 2 times/year and I can't wait to come back to enjoy another meal here. Next time we will make sure to save room for a cannoli!

Atmosphere is amazing...marble countertops, full bar, fans pulling fresh breezes, and tv's with the latest sports. However, as a mid-level wine lover the wine list suffers. Especially the white wine...no Sauv Blancs, no non oaked chardonnays, no Albarinos, no white burgundys...if you're going to be a good Italian restaurant in LV....have a great wine list!!

Great tasting food that even my kids enjoyed!!!. We had a Caprese salad for our appetizer that was great. Some of the freshest basil and creamiest cheese ever. The garlic knots are hot and fresh and with the complimentary cheese, olive and marinated peppers, a great start. Our entrees were piping hot, great taste and filling. We had chicken parmesan, baked ziti and meatballs. All were fantastic. Desert was great !  Finally found a good cannoli and Tiramisu. The price point is a little high, but the location has to be factored in.My only complaint is that my wife substituted whole wheat pasta and charged $2.oo without letting us know. I would pay , but just let me know.

I was staying at red rock this week and went to see downtown summerlin Thursday night. I stumbled upon this restaurant because I could hear the music outside. My friend and I went into eat and loved everything. The staff was so friendly and our waitress Rikki was amazing. We ordered everything she recommended starting with the eggplant rollatini . Our main meal was chicken Francsisse and we finished with ricki's favorite tiramisu. The restaurant outside was a little busy but Rikki was so attentive you would have thought we were the only table around. She definitely loves her job and it shows. I'm coming back to town next month and I will absolutely return to this restaurant.
This place is amazing from the garlic knots to the atmosphere.  Their bruschetta pizza is out of this world.

Turned away when more than half the restaurant was empty for "reservations" when I counted at least 10 empty tables. Was told the wait would be approx 2 hours! Went to CPK & walked by again about 45 minutes later, all tables still empty.... I understand how reservations take precedence as a former host, but a lot of people no show. I've never been turned away from a restaurant with this many empty tables before. Management seriously needs to reevaluate how you do business with walk ins.

I ordered Fettucino Alfredo to go. For the low, low price of just $25, I got a 2 scoops of noodles in a tin container - no parmesan, no cutlery, no napkins. Adding insult to injury, the pasta was undercooked. A travesty by all measures... if someone DOES want to have a relaxing meal in the restaurant, they would have to try to find a spot that doesn't have sports TV's as a feature. Nice music and décor but really? The TV's are in poor taste. But then, so was the meal.

Comfortable Italian restaurant. Staff was polite and friendly, service is quick and attentive, food came out timely and hot. I recommend the Shrimp Stuffed with Crab Meat with Scampi sauce. Delicious. Attire is business casual.

This was our second time here and it was much busier than the first time we came but there was not a wait. Food took a long time to come out but we also didn't tell our waiter we had a movie to catch and our food wasn't going to make it out in time. We asked them to hold it for us and if we could pick it up afterwards. They kept it under the heater for us and the manager came by and offered us a $100 gift card for the inconvenience. It was our fault for not telling them we were going to a movie but the manager took it upon himself to accept responsibility. How amazing! We will definitely be back based on the customer service alone! 

PS- meatballs and calamari are a must try!

Was walking around Downtown Summerlin shopping and decided to try this amazing Italian place. We were greeting right away and sat outside on the patio. They had several heaters which was great.  Our server was also the bartender. She was super sweet and attentive.  They start you out with some awesome bread accompanied by olives, peppers and cheese! We ordered the meatballs, eggplant rigatoni and the sausage pizza.  Everything was absolutely delicious! For dessert we had the tiramisu which had to be one of the best in town!!! They also had live music which made it so much better. I love this place and can't wait to come back!

Cute patio with air!! I wish DT Summerlin wasn't such a concrete jungle- too hot even before summer has heated up. Good was quite tasty and service was good. Not sure about the free garlic knots with oil and balsamic for dipping? They were already pretty oily. Portions look small for lunch but don't be deceived, it was more than enough food but a little pricey for lunch. I had pasta with garlic, olive oil and cracked red pepper. The chef forgot to add the pepper and the waitress failed to notice so I had to ask for them to bring a shaker to the table. Simple flavors are an indicator of a chefs skill and the pasta was perfect and the sauce flavorful (can't believe they forgot an ingredient though). I'll definitely give them another chance- when summer is over ;)

The concept seemed lovely with an indoor/outdoor feel, but the food will not make a repeat visitor out of me. The garlic knots and an antipasto plate were very nice, however the salads we ordered were entrée sized rather than starters-would have preferred half the size at half the price. The Kale salad with peanut dressing was difficult to eat as it was very spicy and very heavily dressed. The Margareta pizza my husband ordered which comes with no cheese (lactose intolerant) was COVERED in capers which were not mentioned anywhere. That is a very specific ingredient that serves mention on the menu. He is not a fan so rolled most off and ate half. I ordered salmon and vegetables-the preparation was fine although a lot of oil appeared on the plate mixed with the lemon sauce-not a fan of that much oil. The vegetables were heirloom squash and zucchini-really cute vegetables! Overall just very hefty priced and neither of us was impressed with our items. Perhaps the pasta is the way to go as there is a very authentic vibe-but we'll pass on by next time in Downtown Summerlin.

Decided to come here after driving all the way from Florida. Four of us sat down and placed our order, and then our waitress Hilga disappeared after that. Thirty minutes have now passed and our beers and drinks are empty but no food is present. Finally flag our server down and she looks at us and tells us yeah yeah it's coming it's on the way and she didn't even refill our drinks! Later, she comes back with a notepad and asks each of us what we ordered and began to write it down! 45 minutes in and she hadn't even given our order to the kitchen. Our server was replaced and they gave us a free antipasti platter that we didn't even want - we just wanted our food at this point. No one touched the platter at all. Our food finally came and we were approached by the manager offering us one cannoli or one slice of cheesecake for the four of us to split. One dessert for four people after sitting there for an hour waiting for our food! When the bill came, there were no apologies and no comping on any of our meals, and the food here isn't cheap at all. Hilga has been our server two times in the past and after the third time, we won't be coming back until she is gone.

Second time here. First time four stars, this time two. It would have been less but Beth came in to save the day! The first time 4 stars due to the horrible tiramisu. This time I would have given 1 star but like I said Beth, the bartender, came in and made the experience so much better with her great personality and social skills. Ricki our "server" was not attentive, OVER charged us, did not bring our antipasto (I had to ask the manager for it). We were there early, at 4pm, when happy hour starts. I recommend waiting until the bartender comes in at 5pm. The restaurant was not busy, there were us and 2 other tables, 6 people total. If you can go Wednesday through Sunday Beth works then, she is amazing. So helpful, always recommending, attentive, pleasant, sociable, etc... Just a fabulous gal all around. This is what I want when sitting at the bar. The kale salad was fabulous, as was the pizza. Last time we were here the Bolognese and calamari was fabulous. The food is outstanding, but Ricki is horrible. If you hate your job, stay home!
Yummy food. Sam was an awesome waiter. The garlic knots were wonderful. The outside sitting area will be a great place to sit in nice weather. Recommend highly.

I am so very happy we went in to this AMAZING place today with my son for lunch! Very pleasant atmosphere, quite, clean, excellent service and attitude. We got all attention, everything was served just right on time, simply delicious! Pizza is just not comparable with retailer's or other restaurants, hand made, thin crust, smells and looks so yammy.
Thank you, the owner and our server. We will be back to this little Italy!

It was awesome!!! The food was very good!! And I loved my server Rodolfo and Hilda and Tony and Bethany but most of ALL GM WAS THE BEST VITO!!!!!

I would reccomended to anyone !

Good tasting food that I'll probably never taste again as I don't want to subject my family to that poor of service. I don't necessarily think that the place has bad service overall, for I witnessed our server take great care of the tables around us - offered fresh pepper, cheese, refills, dessert, etc. None were offered to us, we had to chase her down for refills and remind her the kids meal came with dessert. But what really puzzled me was the portion size of my entree. My linguine with clams entree was smaller than my 2 year old's spaghetti from the kids menu. Both served in the same bowl that's only slightly bigger than the small bread plate. We were excited to try their dessert but we never got that far. I normally base my reviews mostly on the taste of food and just explain my experience with service and ambiance, but the service was just THAT bad.

We called in a pizza order and everything went well so far. Food was good. But after approaching the restaurant was when the bad service happened. Three workers were outside conversing with one another and did not acknowledge us. We spoke to who we assume as the host who told us to proceed to the bar for to go orders. The bartender was nowhere in sight. When she got back to the bar she did not notice me standing in front of the pizza box that was mine. She started grabbing glasses and assumed I wanted a drink but I told her I had a to go order. She roughly throws the bill on top of the pizza box to give to me and then immediately walks away to take an order of a table far away from the bar top. She spends longer than normal taking their order as I glared her down. I've had my credit card on hand since before she got to the bar so there was no wait in me giving her my card. She scans it and sets it down and proceeds to help other customers again! Needless to say, this to go order took as long as a dine in order. We could have finished our pizza in the time it took to wait for her to ring us up so we could leave. Terrible service at the bar. That woman deserves to be fired. Shorter brunette curly haired older woman. Rude and unapologetic. She is the sole reason we will never return even tho the food was decent and the phone call went normally.
I went during the lunchtime hour with a co-worker. The food and service were great. The staff members were friendly and attentive. A good spot for a date night with the wife.

My wife, daughter and I came to Trattoria Reggiano to give it a try after some friends recommended it to us. I would have to say that this place is great. You can tell they are still getting come grand opening details figured out but the food and service were excellent! I have to make sure to mention that Vito the manager went above and beyond to make sure our experience was pleasant. It's not easy going out with a 15 month old and I felt welcome here. I hope they keep it because I plan on returning. Oh and before I forget the meatballs were unreal!
Perfectly prepared chicken for the chicken parmigiana. The ricotta is amazing! Our server, Rodolfo, got everything right

We had an amazing dinner here. Bethany was attentive and friendly! I had the bake ziti with meatballs (took half home just as amazing heated up the next day.) great atmosphere we will definitely be back! Thank you!
Awesome! Food bar and atmosphere is great!!!!!!! Lobster ravioli and the bartender was my favorite.

Poor Service and High Priced Average Food. Best thing is the small free cheese and olive plate. Bummer
4 people over $200+ we had 1 appetizer, 4 entries and 4 cocktails. Server could care less if we received what we ordered and provided zero assistance or recommendations. He missed several items and the only time we saw him was for the order and the check?
Properly survives due to great location.
Tried this place for lunch today and we had a great experience. The food was really good as was the service. The tiramisu was the best part! We will definitely be going back.

Came here for the first time tonight for dinner. Both pizza and pasta were outstanding. Waiter brought some extra freebies while we were waiting for food to arrive. Placed was packed inside and out which was great for a Tuesday night.
Will def return

Great service! Great coffee! Great food!!!
Love this place! It's so hard to find such a great Caesar salad and this place has an amazing one!!!!!!

The food was excellent. I had the eggplant parm and it was delicious. The bread was great and the casear salad was exceptional. The soup with meatballs was very good as well. The only downside was the lack of inside seating. We had to sit outside and it was pretty windy.

Pleasantly surprised, excellent service. I had made a reservation and we were seated exactly upon arrival on a Friday night. Food was large portions, well prepared but I was most surprised by the attentive service. I've eaten at every restaurant in downtown Summerlin and this one just jumped to one of our favorites. Much better than Grape Street both in terms of food quality and definitely in terms of service. Keep it up!

The calamari with spicy marinara was great and so were the garlic knots. Pasta was just okay, a little bland. Paulo, our server/bartender, couldn't care less about his professionalism or even his job, for that matter. We had to ask for water twice and all he said was "oh I didn't bring them huh". We asked for the check and we waited 15 minutes because he forgot it...again. No apology. 

The Venetian location is 10x better. I won't be back to this one.

I love this place. Plain and simple. The food is fantastic, the service perfect, and the atmosphere welcoming. The party I went with all got different entrees from the menu and we shared them. Everything was good, and we couldn't agree which entree was the best. I loved the pasta a la vodka, my wife loved the linguini Bolognese, and my brother loved the tortellini alfredo. Bottom line it was all great. Be careful though, I highly recommend saving room for dessert. The cheesecake is one of the best I've ever had, and the tiramisu was delicious. On top of all of this or server made great recommendations, was extremely friendly, and made us excited to return again. The manager introduced herself to us and chatted with us for a minute. It was a wonderful dining experience and I can't wait to come back and try more items from the menu.

Table for 3

The pro:
-Service 

The con:
-Lobster Ravioli 
*Lackluster on the sauce when it came to flavor and depth. 
*Pasta was still doughy

-Gnocchi al Pesto
*Lackluster on the flavor of the sauce as well, however beautiful color and consistency that is pesto.

-Seafood Linguini
*Oddly there was a pool of sauce or pasta water, I don't recall, but wasn't at all pleasing to see. 

Not the best or worst Italian food, it was just okay. The food lacked a lot of the hearty flavor profiles that is Italian.

New to Vegas, so I'm still exploring all the good spots to eat. Seeing I love italian food, I had to try it here. They didn't have my favorite dish which is chicken piccata but they did have my second which is shrimp scampi so that is the only reason they got 4 stars and not 5 stars. 

I started my meal out with their steamed mussels, hot cheesy rolls and with oil and balsamic vinegar on the side. Then ordered their shrimp scampi, the shrimps were larger and cooked to perfection. The pasta tasted awesome with the lemon butter sauce. 

They also have a bar where you can come just get a drink and watch a game or something. 

The service was on point and they made sure you had everything you need, not pushy at all. Sonic your ever in Vegas and want some Italian food, I recommend you come here.

It was an okay meal. The tortellini with alfredo was a very small serving for the price. Sauce was bit bland and very thin. The pasta itself was tender and very good.
My husband had the baked ziti with meat balls and enjoyed it.
Calamari was good. The spicy marinara was delicious. 
 We both agree we will not go back but it was okay for a last minute lunch.
$77 before tip for two people. No salad with the meal. 
We are Italian, rarely go out for Italian food as it is hard to  find authentic/really good food around here. Can honestly say this is no better than Olive Garden. Olive garden is less expensive and the food is the same quality

One of my very favorite places to dine ! Delicious Authentic Italian Cuisine,  attentive service and a beautiful atmosphere. My Favorite Mother's Day Dinner choice. 
Five Stars

Maybe I didn't order the right thing. Maybe they were having an off-day. Or maybe...I was just excited to catch up with my friend I just picked the first thing I saw on the menu.

I came here on a Saturday evening. Surprisingly....parking was easy to find. I saw plenty of parking spaces in the lots AND in the garage. 

I ordered the Linguine Bolognese-ground beef with some kind of tomato sauce, fresh herbs and spices, tossed with light Parmesan. It SOUNDS delicious but really, it was a let down. Wasn't very flavorful and tasted bland. Too much pasta but not even meat sauce. Also....this restaurant is pretty pricy for what it's really worth. $22 freakin dollars for my entrée. If you want to add chicken, shrimp etc....it's like $6 extra. For this kind of price...I could have gotten a much better quality dinner at Bootlegger Bistro!! Ugh.... =/

First timers, No complaints here. Food was excellent, service was outstanding, especially bartenders  Eli and Bethany. Spicy calamari, lobster ravioli, and baked ziti with filet mignon and pork loin meatballs were fantastic. Will definitely return!
This place has the best pasta in Summerlin! Ask for Ricki to be your waitress, she'll give you top notch service!

The food was great, and the atmosphere is lovely. Most restaurants of this caliber neglect the vegetables not this place they were cooked perfectly. Unfortunately I couldn't give it five stars cause the restaurant is located across from Dave & busters .

New favorite place at DT Summerlin request Paolo he treated us like we were the most important people in the room and he's Italian from Milano. Gives the place a REAL vibe.  Felt like we were sitting in Italy.

 Great place to go right before seeing a movie, it's literally right next door to Regal DT Summerlin. 

They have a Happy hour too which is nice and the outdoor seating is really comfortable a real plus is you can hear yourself talk. Unlike some of the other restaurants in DT it's a great place to connect and meet with friends, we loved it! Service by Paolo was superb, I know I said it again but it's worth repeating. Great calamari, Chicken Parm is one of the dishes they're known for. We had such fun and loved it. See Vito the manager and ask for Paolo you won't be disappointed...

Looked like a decent place for a meal, reasonable priced. But when we ordered we asked for a substitution on a pizza. Obviously was a crime since we were scolded by an older Italian man (only because he informed us he was Italian and they don't have sorporsetta only salami) I said weird as it says you have it on the menu (proceeded to point out to him) we were repaid by being served scorching hot pizza - enough to cause a 2nd degree burn.

I went here with my co worker before we went to a concert on New Year's day.  The hostess was a little rude when I said I had no RSVP and seated us in the patio in the freezing cold.  Luckily they had heaters.  The food was good.  I had the Scampi and my co worker had the Frutta de mare.  I'll be back to try the desserts with my husband.  It was pricey but I think it was good overall.
Service has considerably improved.  Food is really good. Like the atmosphere.  Happy to see things have changed.

So, I'm not Italian but lived in Rome, Italy from the end of second grade through High School and have returned to visit many times. It is one place I call home. Coming to Tratorria Regiano reminded me a bit of what I come to expect when revisiting Italy. Good food and excellent service are both on display here. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and specials, which was very nice indeed, but I was more focused on the native Italian busboy who cleared the table and supplied the Reggiano to my party's salads and pasts dished. The man couldn't have been much younger than 70 years old and he was totally committed to making sure our table was always well-attended to. I forgot the man's name but I want him to know that I give the restaurant the extra star for his exceptional service. I had the ravioli and it was made al dente just as it would have been made back home, in Roma. The salad was huge and my friend's plates were delectable looking as well. Buona fortuna, Tratorria Reggiano e ci vediamo subito!
Very festiv atmosphere for Christmas shopping, and great Red wine sangria to take the edge off!

The garlic knots are massive and so delicious! The pizza was pretty good, I got the Salame Piccante - Pepperoni but I've never seen garlic knots so big in my life and I'm kind of in love with them now.

Went there with my mom she really picky with Italian food ! Everything taste amazing !! 
Mimmo was our server he treat us with worm hospitality and make us feel like In a real authentic restaurant . Good atmosphere great vibe we defiantly coming back again.

I give this restaurant three stars. Although the drinks and the food came out in a timely manner our waitress did not check on us. Our busboy; however, did a great job. He checked on us more than the waitress. I'd eat here again.
Right now a big thumbs down. Our 20 minute wait has turned into 70 minutes.  Dear hostess learn how to judge time there are right now a good 20 angry people outside and pissed

The wait was a little bit long. So we sat at the bar for a couple drinks. It was all just okay. After we finally got seated we decided to have the Meatballs! They were delicious, probably the best part of the experience. My boyfriend got the truffle Alfredo and it was 44$. I had a bite and it definitely was not worth the 44$. I would not come back here for anything in particular. The experience was just okay.

I really wish they would get some servers who had a sense of urgency. The last time we went i swore it off, but its right next to the movies. The food is really good. Ill either get a pizza or the veal chop parm on the bone. All the food is good but they have zero attention to detail and they are so slooooooooooooow. Last time was the worst. This time things started off well, appetizer came out quickly, food came fast too. Then it's just crickets. Sit sit sit sit.. I decided to walk around to find our waiter. No where to be found. I ask the hostess if she can locate him. She came back and said the guy is in the bathroom. I get it, guy has to go, but use ur head and ask someone to look after your tables if u r gonna be 20 mins. Finally, we got the check, i left 10 bux on 70 and a note telling them how slow they are. Im not going back anymore. It good food but not worth guarantees awful service.

My husband and I went here this past sunday we had a 530 reservation, it was not packed at all, The service was great, the food was great and our server Hilda was really nice.   Oh and real cannolis just like NY  yay   we will def be back
Stuff to try: Calamari and Lasagna. The garlic bread was great too! I will definitely come back for more.
Amazing food and service all around.  Everything tastes high quality and the portions are large.  Every time we go the food is equally delicious and the servers are attentive.  Will keep going back!

Not that good. The service was great! The food was just okay. Really expensive for what you got. Had the mussels and they were fishy and still had some sand in them. The meatballs were a weird consistency. Just not that good. I will not be going back. 
l

The food was delicious, we ate outside even though it was chilly. They kept the outside patio very warm for us and there was a live singer outside while we ate. This made the experience better and relaxing as well. The server was kind and efficient with our entrees. The dinner overall was pleasant.

Been here before and had a good experience with one of the friendly bartenders. I guess that was our only lucky day here. Things went downhill fast this visit. This time was completely awful. It ruined my daughters birthday dinner! Very disappointed in how they OVER CHARGE for dietary restrictions or substitutions. Since when does it make sense to sub out prosciutto for broccoli florets for $5 charge? Well it was $5, and There were maybe 6 broccoli florets in the entire dish. Felt like I was being nickled and dimed. Had I known that they were importing the broccoli from Mars or blessed in holy water, I could've went to Trader Joe's across the way and brought my own to save money. Anyways, We ordered the gluten free version of penne ala vodka. This item comes with prosciutto. The server informed me I would not even be receiving anything close to the menu item that was already priced at $30. No vodka no prosciutto no pink sauce. So what was it that we were receiving? Still have no idea to this day. The server had such an attitude problem about everything from the start, we should've known it wasn't going to be a pleasant experience. We also put an order in for a Cesar salad as a starter no croutons. I asked if we could add onions to the salad. Insert eye roll from server here. She finished taking our order and walked away. Our salad arrived with our pasta, 30 mins later! The server made sure to bob and weave away from us as to not answer any of our questions. She did not want to come up with an explanation as to why it took 30 mins for a starter salad to arrive! The really nice busser was kind of enough to refill our waters and provide my 5 year old daughter with bread. My husband and I had our food come out before my daughters basic spaghetti with marina! Everyone knows you serve the kids food first before the adults, especially when it's simple pasta with marina already cooked in the back. Alas, our server was unaware of such hospitality. We flagged her down asking where our daughters food was, she said oh lemme check and never came back. The friendly busser came to the rescue with my daughters food. We finished our meal and asked for the check. We were shocked to see a $6 charge for gluten free pasta and a $5 charge for broccoli. We asked the server why so expensive if it's technically not penne ala vodka and substitute broccoli. She said that was policy. Wooooow. We then noticed a charge for $3. We asked what was this about? She said it was for the onions in the salad?!?!?! So you're telling me it was $4 to put 6 onion slices in a small cedar? Was it farmed to table in that very instance? In what universe is this acceptable? I've managed some high end restaurants and been bar manager at others, none of these "standards" would've been acceptable. Broccoli is nowhere near the price of prosciutto. Why would you charge someone for vodka sauce if they're not getting vodka sauce? She might as well charged me for a steak and said well it's the same thing. To round off the crap night, I had to ask the server 3 times if she could sing happy birthday to my daughter. She brought a cannoli with no candle or anything. She was too busy to even acknowledge my kid or smile at the very least. She set the plate before her and did not even try to light the candle. She just walked off! Two tables down it was someone else's birthday and what do you know? They had a wonderful server who got the whole restaurant to sing a joyous happy birthday to them and with a smile! Must've been a nice feeling. Explain to me why she's in the hospitality business again? Thanks for a horrible memory on a special day. Do not waste your time or money at this place unless you're a masochist and love flushing money down the drain. Go to the other Italian places in downtown summerlin or wolf gang puck. They always treat you with respect and never charge you extra.

I was really hoping to like this place. I had seen the one in the Venetian many times and it was always crowded. I now realize that that was filled with tourists, most likely one-time only patrons. The food here was kind of flat and monotonous. The marinara sauce is bland. This is a beautiful restaurant if a bit pretentious. I get a sense that this place is run by a heavy-handed egotistical owner or manager that cannot see-through to its problems. I watched the management while I was dining here, and they seemed stern and unaccommodating. Our waiter was very friendly, almost too much so. I will probably try it again, just in case I was there on a bad day. All in all however, I was disappointed.

A friend wanted to try this place, I was reluctant.
I am SO GLAD that I said OK! Our dinner was really great.

I ordered the caesar and cheese tortellini....I know a little boring I was feeling "classic" (don't judge! LOL). The caesar was dressing was creamy and flavorful. I think the tortellini was homemade. Not sure if it was made right there, but either way tasted very homestyle! Yes, that is a good thing!

My friend had an Arugula Salad - It was SO SO SO good! (better than my caesar) and spaghetti carbonara. Delish as well.

For desert we had a piece of chocolate cake that was as big as my head! There you go, judging again! LOL....It was GOOD!!! And no, we did not even eat 1/2 of it! Although I wanted to! 

Great place, and it can get busy because Downtown Summerlin is catching on as the new spot to go play and eat! If you are thinking a weekend night, I suggest making reservations

Wow. First time and last time. Reservations for 6:45. Seated at 7:30. Service was terrible. I ordered primavera pizza. Soggy and tasteless. Sent it back and ordered Bolognese. Husband ordered Scampi. Pasta undercooked and tasteless. Shrimp were ok. Terrible experience. A lady came in with a dog that sat in a chair and we overheard this was a lady with the owner. Wow.

Great food, pizza  drinks amd service Moscow Mule was excellent and Garlic bread appatizer / olives awesome!!.. I had eggplant Parmesan which was good but the sauce was very Sweet boarding on A Chef Boyardee vibe!! The entertainment and outdoor patio is a nice bonus at DTS.. Hey Trattoria please just overhaul your red sauce and you got the 5th star!!
Food was great!  First time here...quick bite in between showing homes today...Joli and I split a chicken parm sandwich...perfect for 2.  Our server Ricki was great!  Thank you!

My first review of this restaurant was in October after we went with some friends and everything was delicious.  Well not so this time.  While the service was good it was not as good as last time.  Last time they brought out a plate of cheese, roasted peppers and red, green and black olives that were fantastic.  This time there was only one of those green olives on the plate and when I asked the waiter for the more and for the other colors he found a few more green ones and said that was all there were which I find hard to believe.  Last time the garlic knots were wonderful.  This time they were very doughy and undercooked although very brown on top.  I had the same meal, baked ziti and while last time it was delicious this time I could hardly eat it.  The other meals were just ok.  Nothing to rave about like our last visit.

Towards the end of our meal they sat a very large party behind us although there really wasn't enough room and the waitress kept bumping into me every time she had to get through.  At one point she told me I needed to move my chair in.  If we were not getting ready to leave I definitely would have said something.

I also think that either the prices went up or they have a higher priced menu because it is during the holidays but I can tell you that we probably will not be going back there.

Great service from Ricki, even better food. Be sure to order the calamari. The garlic knots hint at how good their pizza must be. Penne ala vodka had a great, subtile guiancale flavor to it. The Linguine with the white clam sauce was perfectly seasoned in a slightly thick bodied sauce of deep complexity. The clams, in shell, were ocean fresh, impeccably clean and plentiful. The linguine was prepared perfectly al dente. Service was like a light breeze, barely noticeable, but just there and appreciated. Consider re training your hostess, as we requested a quiet table and she attempted to seat us in front of the restroom!

Tried this place for the first time last night and I liked it. We were seated outside so it was a little chilly, but at least they had the heaters to make up for it. Their garlic bread is delicious and is a great way to start your meal. I had the chicken francese and really enjoyed it. The chicken was cooked right and it was tender and juicy, while the pasta was alright. It's pretty awesome that they have a live performer as well when I went. I can see this place as a great place to go for a date night.

What a major disappointment!  I ordered penne primavera and it was served sitting in warm water. There was no flavor at all.  I pointed it out to the waiter, who replaced it, and also had it taken off the bill.  The replacement was ok, but not flavorful enough to bring me back.  I truly wonder if the food quality is dependent on who is in the kitchen.  The reviews go from 5 stars to "blah". I also ordered the kale peanut salad which was too acidic for my taste.  The two stars are only for the waiter, "Giovanni" who I would give five stars, but I don't want anyone to think it is for the food.  I think management needs to do a better job on what leaves the kitchen and goes to the table.
Walking away after standing at the hostess station for 3 mins while being stared at by the kitchen staff and not seated or acknowledged.   Guess they don't want our business.

The service was top notch. No complaints there - our drinks were always filled and my brother took his last sip of his beer just as the waiter asked if he'd like another. Really on top of things. However... The prices they charge for their food is a little ridiculous. I got the chicken parm and while it was good it was just your regular chicken parm, not worth the $26. The salmon my mom got was dry and flavorless. The pesto gnocchi my sister got was super bland. The pizza my brother got was good but didn't really have much to it in terms of flavor. The entire meal was definitely over priced. They had an Italian band playing too. And his voice was nice, but it was really too loud. We can barely talk to each other without screaming.
