It kinda threw it all off. Maybe it would be a better ambience for a one on one date? But not for a family. We won't be back, unfortunately.

We have been here three times and all three times I have been very disappointed.  The service is great but the seafood dishes have been very disappointing!  The first time I ordered linguini and clams. at least six clams didn't open and the sauce was bland and flavorless and the clams had a very fishy taste and smell.  They did give me additional clams but half of them had broken shells that led me to believe they took the ones that didn't open and just broke the shells to get the clams out. I didn't eat them because if a clam shell doesn't open on its own it is because the clam is already dead and who knows how long it has been dead.

Second time there I had the shrimp scampi. The shrimp were not over cooked but they were stuffed!?  The breading they were stuffed with were soaking in oil.  There was no delightful garlic/wine sauce it was just butter and stuffing.  So I removed the stuffing and ate the six or seven shrimp.

The third time I ordered the shrimp and linguini in their red sauce.  The shrimp tasted very fishy again and the red sauce was utterly bland! It was extremely disappointing.  

My husband had their veal parmesan and said it was good except that the veal wasn't pounded down and the thickness was a little off-putting and a too thick breading covered the veal.

He also had, on another visit, their carbonara and he liked it a lot and on our third visit he had the baked ziti and thought it was very good but the meatballs were  horrible.

Our friend had the lobster ravioli in a pink sauce.  The pink sauce had a very mild flavor and he said it was okay.

The garlic knot bread is good and the service is good.  The manager or owners ask you how everything is and we always say it's good but I just don't like to make negative remarks in front of their customers so this review is more for them and I just pray the read it.  

We love everything about the restaurant but the seafood dishes need a major overhaul and they need to remake their meatball recipe.
Food was good but service was terrible. Took over an hour to get our food. I don't suggest coming here unless you have three hours of spare time to eat a half decent italian meal.

A friend of mine recommended this place to me. I was hesitant at first, but then just decided to try it out. I was very pleased. I went with my husband and our 9 yr old son. I had the Gnocci al Pesto and...OH. MY. GOD. It was so delicious. My husband had the Baked Ziti with Meatballs - it looked do good, I had to taste it. Oh the cheesy goodness! And my son had the pepperoni pizza - normal 9 yr old boy food. He loved it too! He ate more than half of it which is a miracle in itself, because he's not a big eater. Our server, Theresa was very nice and very pleasant. The restaurant is small and quaint but felt authentic and welcoming. We couldn't have been happier with our experience, and will definitely be returning soon...especially since it is our new favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I even like it more than Maggiano's.

This restaurant has great food, great service and great ambiance. I love the garlic knots instead of bread. Our server was nice and funny. I love the open kitchen and the classy decor throughout the restaurant. My food was delicious.
The chocolate cake is AMAZING!

Nice restaurant, very good service. Food was good. Pizza seems to be their best menu item. Garlic knots were very good. Baked ziti was good. Portion sizes are decent. Surprisingly, filet meatballs weren't as good as I thought they would be - caprese was presented nicely but lacking in flavor.

Came her for dinner after a family friend's wedding. I ordered the "your way" with strawberry. Had to send it back since it was awful, but I got the Italian sangria. It was much better. I ordered the swordfish. Freakin delicious. My bf ordered the chicken parmigiana. It was tasty, but there was nothing special about it. Other people at our table ordered the lasagna (said it was the best Italian food they've ever had), linguine bolognese (couldn't stop chowing down) and the linguine in clam sauce (said the clams were delightful. All-in-all a great experience. Very kind and attentive staff.

The original Trattoria Reggiano location inside the Venetian is pretty popular, and has had a 4 star average for as long as I can remember. So, when we first arrived to this new second location, it wasn't too shocking to hear we'd have a little bit of wait (30-45 minutes) even on a Sunday at 7pm. But it wasn't until nearly an hour and fifteen minutes later that we walked in and got seated on the patio of what might be the smallest restaurant in Downtown Summerlin. 

Up until we got seated, there had only been one other party that put there name down to wait. In the time that we waited the place really started to clear out, and shortly after we got seated, there was only a handful of tables sat. The place was pretty much dead. But for whatever reason, a table of about 6 people had the whole staffs attention. They had been there the whole time we waited for a table, and were there during our whole meal. Obviously either very close friends, or family of someone associated with the restaurant. Food was coming out to them in waves, and nearly every staff member was waiting on them hand and foot. It took 20 minutes just for our waiter to come over after being sat, and throughout the meal, it didn't improve. Drinks and food took forever to come out, we had to ask for refills multiple times, and the guy seemed to barely know the menu. To put it lightly, the service sucked. Even if every waiter here was new, this restaurant has enough experience that they shouldn't have untrained staff, or even crappy service in general. 

When it comes to the menu, it looks like it's pretty much exactly the same as the original location. They have a variety of classic Italian dishes, some pizza, seafood, etc. Pricing doesn't seem to be any different, and is about average for this style of Italian restaurant. 

We were brought out an order of complimentary garlic knots. The flavor was actually pretty good and they had good texture, but holy friggin' grease. These things felt like they were made and then just rolled in oil. They also brought a little pepper, olive and cheese tray. It was okay, but I'm glad I didn't pay for either. Not really an impressive start.

I had pretty much already made up my mind on what I was going to order before we even came here. The filet meatballs sound good, and usually get great reviews. So, I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The noodles were cooked well, obviously not hand made or anything, but decent. What really let me down was the meatball. I'd say mentioning filet mignon in the title is just a way to sucker you into ordering them. If there is filet mignon in them, the amount is so little it's impossible to taste. They really just taste like straight up pork meatballs with no seasoning. At $14 for an appetizer order of meatballs, and $18 for the spaghetti and meatballs, there should be no doubt that filet mignon is in them. Their supposed house made pomodoro sauce is alright, but this is far from an $18 plate.

At this point, I was done and not even thinking about trying their dessert. But most of my table wanted dessert, and oddly enough, it was the best thing about this place. Sort of. They have a "homemade" chocolate cake that looks just like the garbage Claim Jumper serves, so I passed on trying that. Their tiramisu was excellent though, and really was the saving grace of the night. I'd literally come back just for that, and would likely try the ricotta cheesecake too.

Maybe I expected too much...but with a pretty dang successful restaurant, in the Venetian of all places, I thought TR would have a lot more to offer. Long waits, horrible service, and below average food just wasn't what I had hoped for.
This place a excellent! The spaghetti and meatballs were the best I have ever had. The staff were very nice and helpful. My husband and I both enjoyed the food and we will definitely be back again!
One of my favorite places to eat lunch in Downtown Summerlin. Rikki is always so attentive and friendly. She knows what I like to eat, and how I like it prepared. Always a great experience.

One of the new additions to the Downtown Summerlin dining scene. The dining room is nicely decorated with warm colors and is brightly lit. The outdoor patio has comfortable seating and  has some privacy from the adjacent foot traffic. Ceiling fans and overhead heaters make this a year round venue.
Our party of four chose the patio on this evening. We were seated immediately and welcomed by several staff members. Our server Amanda was attentive and helpful. She had a up beat attitude and I felt that she was truly interested in providing us with great service. Amanda along with her associates  followed up throughout the meal. 
The complementary dinner rolls with bottles of olive oil and balsamic vinegar were provided  for the table. We ordered the Filet Mignon Meatballs as a starter. The three large meatballs were plenty for sharing. The shaved Parmigiano Reggiano was offered as a topping. Four different entrees were ordered. Eggplant Parmigiana was  layered in traditional pomodoro sauce and lots of melted mozzarella. The Chicken Caesar Salad included several large pieces of grilled chicken. The Lobster Ravioli was topped with shrimp, sauteed in a pink sauce and white wine. The ravioli pillows just melted in your mouth and the shrimp were tender and juicy. The Chicken Francese was a breast sauteed in lemon-white wine sauce and a touch of butter served with spaghetti. Both the Eggplant and Chicken Francese were especially large and resulted in some to take home. All of the entrees were cooked perfectly to our satisfaction. Freshly shaved Parmigiano Reggiano was also offered as a topping for the entrees.
Two desserts were ordered for sharing. Ricotta cheese cake was moist with a long lasting cheese flavor. The tiramisu is served in a goblet with two sticks of cookies. The saucer on which the goblet sits has drizzled caramel sauce. The location of the caramel adds eye appeal but scooping it up is not easy. I would rate the tiramisu as just OK. 
One note on the restrooms. A restaurant this size should have more than one restroom. As I waited in line a server mentioned that there is a public restroom next door to the restaurant. The woman behind me decided to check it out but she returned to say the line at that one was longer.

Came in for lunch. We ordered Pasta Fagioli soup. This is my favorite soup and this was by far the best I ever ate.  I  then had Spaghetti Aglio E Olio and surprisingly (I felt) was a very small portion but it was very flavorful. I had a side of meatballs  which consisted of 2 nice size meatballs. Everyone has their own preference of how a meatball should be made/taste  and to me these were perfect! My husband had chicken parmigiana with spaghetti and the chicken was huge.  He said it was good. Our server was Ricki and she was great. Though quite expensive.....$70.00 for lunch! (no dessert, no drinks except for one soda) we enjoyed the food and service.

The food was delicious, the service was awesome, the prices were a little too much in our opinion. 

I also do not agree with restaurants that charge for gluten free options. Being gluten free for some isn't just some fad diet. They charge $5 for gluten free options. It's not fair for those who have no choice in being gluten free. That's why I gave 3 stars.

Best place in downtown summerlin for food quality! The place is small but it's nice! 

All the items we ordered were fresh and tasted amazing! We will travel here even if no plans at DT summerlin...recommend for everyone!

I recommend a reservation due to the lack of size

The food here was very nice and the service was second to none. But never order a glass of wine you will only get a quarter glass at $11 for a Zinfandel. Not good. And the food also is a little high someone has to tell them that they are not on the strip. This is my second time there and I will return after I get a loan from the bank. LOL. Give it a try just bring a little extra cash. The first time I came here I love it and still do. I just don't remember it so pricey.

The second star is for the garlic knots. We ordered a pizza. I've lived in NYC, I've had great pizza. Been wanting to try this place for a while. I'm not exaggerating: the pizza came to the table cold and soaking and flimsy as a wet noodle. Literally like a cold, wet noodle. The "crust" was so incredibly thin and floppy and wet and cold that I started to take a photo for this review BUT before I could do that, a woman collapsed in the restaurant and hit her head and wasn't getting up. Please understand this next part and read carefully: I was sitting at the far end of the restaurant and there was a ridiculous amount of servers working in this place. Like two servers to a customer. At least 15. The bartender, servers, hostess, and manager just stood there like stunned sheep, so I was the first person to call 911. After running across the restaurant by myself, they obviously had no kind of training in place for an emergency situation. People acted like I was a hero for merely possessing common sense. After the ambulance showed up and took the woman away, the general manager commended me and comped our entire bill. I explained the pizza issue to him and he acted like he knew about it and was embarrassed, but here's the kicker: the guy was from New York....and he allows his kitchen to serve sloppy cold pizza!? But hey, the free garlic knots were incredible!

Great Italian restaurant! Last time I had antipasto platter & penne a la vodka which both were amazing! Tonight's calamari & baked ziti were equally as good! Friendly staff that was very personable! Bethany at the bar was awesome and had great suggestions! Easy to see why there were so many regulars at the bar recognized by name !

Can't wait to go back!

The food here was ok, nothing to write home about.  We had a large party and we got several different items.  The biggest problem I had is why I'm giving them 2 stars - their bartender apparently doesn't know what Blue Moon (the original wheat) is.  They had both the regular wheat on the menu and the "seasonal", which is a white IPA.  I told him that I wanted the original Blue Moon, to which he proceeded to argue with me telling me that Blue Moon IS an IPA. He said that they'd been getting people complaining because they thought it wasn't an IPA.  That's because it is most definitely not!!  He assured me that it was the regular Blue Moon so I ordered one.  It was the seasonal.  I didn't want to argue with him any further so I just let it go and someone else at the table drank it.  

I hope that management will take this review into account and train their staff about the difference here.  This isn't an uncommon beer and most places carry it, so for it to taste like a completely different type of beer means that either your lines are mixed up or your staff doesn't know what they're serving.  If you're out of the regular that's fine, but don't try to tell me that something I've been drinking for over 6 years is something that it's not!  Please see my picture for proof of what I'm referring to.

This review is for 3.5 stars. 

Very good food with a good atmosphere, but the overall experience of the meal just didn't meet the standard of the other location in the strip. We had he house specialty pasta which came with a red sauce, sundried tomatoes, and spinach, as well as the gnocchi in a vodka sauce. Both pastas were delicious and fresh but extremely bland, with not much going on besides the pasta and sauce. I guess that's normal for good Italian but I usually enjoy busier dishes. The bread, garlic knots, were actually quite good and I devoured 2, especially dipping in the entree sauces. We were finally given a complimentary olive and pepper dish to start out that was just par. Drinks are expensive and not very good to be frank. I ordered a Manhattan and it was just alcohol thrown into a glass, with no real craft. The house wine is $11 and truly is a house wine. Meal came to around a surprisingly expensive $70. Not worth the cost in my opinion with service underwhelming as well. But nonetheless a strip type of restaurant in downtown Summerlin.

I think it all started out on a bad note and there wasn't a recovery during our visit. 

Asking guests to wait outside until a table inside is ready (aka 108 degrees) while there is only 1 other table of 4 seated in the restaurant (should have been my first clue) is a bad start. Being pressured to order= I really hate that. It was my first time here,  I needed some time. I was also confused why the host is asking for my order minutes after we sat down? If your host is going to take orders, they should know the specials of the day! Alright, so that was an awkward start...

They bring Garlic knots that are generous and appear very appetizing. Overly greasy, soggy in olive oil, a raw garlic flavor; lighter on the oil and some nice crisp on the bread would be a big improvement.

Fella ordered the meatball sandwich (comes with fries); I went with a Caesar salad because I was already suspicious. (AKA: servers and line cooks talking about their dates last night loudly by my table in a big empty restaurant, doesn't make me feel like kitchen is strong on their game). Our food arrived so quickly I was surprised and a little suspicious (microwave?); the cheese appeared oddly coagulated, melted but not bubbly like a nice toasted meatball sam.

The salad- flavorful dressing but overdressed and I wasn't a fan of the full anchovy presented on top. Top it off- last bite was a sour tomato. Trying to eliminate that flavor from my mouth, I took some fries from my fella's dish, and sure enough the oil had a strange taste. I couldn't get the strange oil taste of my palette from these fries. 

My favorite things from the experience were the fresh flowers on the table and the Andes mint that finally neutralized the weird fry oil taste.

My boyfriend and I gave this place a 3 star review solely because of the food. It looked really nice inside and because of our Italian craving, we found this spot to be something new to try. The food was presented wonderfully, but the taste just doesn't match its good looks.

To be honest, this was nothing special. Their food, for the prices that they were, didn't seem to really be worth it. My pasta was mediocre, our pizza was as well. 

I think the one thing that stood out was the really friendly customer service from our server for the evening. She was very attentive and accommodating. While we waited for our food she brought us out a little tray of cheeses and olives to snack on. 

I don't think we'll find ourselves here again, but it wasn't a bad place. Would I recommend this to anyone else? No, because it wouldn't be the first Italian restaurant to cross my mind, BUT if someone were to ask me if they should eat there, I don't think I would try and dissuade them.

I'm torn between 2 and 3 stars. I wasn't impressed but I wasn't really disappointed. It's closer to A OK, but I've definitely had better. Everything was just alright. It tries hard but falls short. They do offer complimentary garlic bread and an antipasto plate. The cheese on the plate was not good at all. The olives were eh, and the canned roasted peppers were just that....canned...or jarred..whatever. Not fresh made. So, as much as I enjoy free stuff, I like free stuff thats good. I'd pass on the antipasto next time.
There were 8 of us so we tried a bunch of stuff. I really enjoyed the eggplant rolatini, that was so good. The calmari were OK, but I didn't think the meatballs were great the way people raved about them. I ordered the fruit de mare pasta dish. It was alright. I'd try something else next time if I decided to come back. We had a couple of bottles of the sangria (half price during happy hour), and we enjoyed that. 
I'm a HUGE fan of eggplant rolatini, and theirs was good, so if I did come back, it would be for that. Service was alright. Cost was what you'd expect for Summerlin. Oh, be mindful of prices. They differ from menu to menu.

The best thing you might eat here are the garlic knots. I think I came close to eating two baskets worth all by myself. I didn't care if I wreaked of garlic or that I'd be sweating it out of my pores the next day, they were pretty damn good. As for the rest of the stuff I tried... meh. The menu is typical Italian-American food, the kind of stuff you'll see in a million other spots. Perfect for the non-adventurous eater -- the kind of diner who thinks not eating at a national chain is a bit risky. 

The kitchen plays it safe and turns out unremarkable food. Meatballs ($14) made from a filet mignon and pork loin mixture were too hard and dense with a sauce that lacked depth. The small portion of the kale peanut salad ($8) was plenty to share, but the underdressed dish had me reaching for water to wash it down. The end of the meal took a turn for the better with a satisfying, but uninspired, lasagna ($22) with ground filet, ricotta, and mozzarella.

Kid menus are available as well. My son's spaghetti (ordered sans tomato sauce, just butter) was a sizable portion that he devoured. Each kid's meal comes with a beverage and mini cannoli.

Located steps away from the movie theater in Downtown Summerlin, it's a nice looking space with a large patio and a smaller than expected interior, with a bar and open kitchen. The food is more paint-by-numbers than Monet, but is just good enough to satisfy a suburban customer base used to eating recognizable Italian.

2.5 Stars

Long time Las Vegas resident (over 33 years) and must say this is a wonderful place. Great food, terrific ambiance and service. Never had a disappointing meal from pizza's to spaghetti and meatballs, seafood, and more. Great bread, olives and peppers to kick things off. 
Thanks!

Wow! Great food. Great atmosphere. Do not go there without trying the meatballs, they are fabulous!

Oh, and the service there was the best.

Our service was great and the food was good but I feel like it was a little over priced.

Maybe it is because Trattoria is in downtown summerlin but $18 for a salad seems excessive to me. We ordered the Kale salad, a margherita pizza and a cannoli. The garlic knots served before hand were amazing! I could have eaten a whole basket of those and left content. They were warm, fresh and smeared with butter and garlic. Carb heaven. 

Our server was great and split the salad for us so we each had a good portioned amount and the pizza came out perfectly with a chewy crust and a little char on it from the brick oven. They use authentic Italian tomato sauce here and the flavors and unmatched. The cannoli was authentic and perfectly sweet and a nice finish to the meal.  

I forsee enjoying the patio here when it isn't oven temperatures outside and I would like to come back to try a happy hour here as well. I appreciated how well our server took care of us.

We love this place. Everything from service, food, drinks and  atmosphere is excellent. I don't love everything on the menu but we LOVE the meatballs, soups, several pasta dishes, caprese salad and the pizza is excellent!! Tiramisu is fresh, homemade and unlike all other restaurants. The indoor/outdoor restaurant always feels cozy. We love the patio but when it's chilly we like inside just as much. Saturday night with live music is fun and relaxing for date night. We've even run into a few famous folks here while enjoying the live, old school (rat pack type) of music. Great for people watching too:)  We've been many times, and I failed to write a review sooner. However, after visiting another Italian place also in DTS that left us regretting our need to try something new,  I felt compelled to write this review before I forget again.

I had the Stromboli and a slice of pie. The pizza was good! The service could you some work, but they did the basic job. I did have a couple flies flying around the place when I was inside so they need a door fan or something like that. Good prices for its location in downtown Summerlin! I would come back!

This was a great decision in an area with so many options. Fine dining Italian at it's very best with a beautiful decor. 
 We didn't have a reservation on a Friday early evening and we were quickly accommodated on the patio which has heaters. We shared a few dishes including the fantastic meatball app, some of the best ever! Gnocchi with pesto was perfect, finished with fresh roasted pine nuts and the pinot noir matched nicely the dishes we selected. 
 Service is top notch and the staff works as a team. Our server was right on, checked on us and knew when to leave us to enjoy. She was awesome! I'm very picky with Italian, this was the best we've had in the area. We had a very delicious and comfortable experience and we'll be back soon. Highly recommended!! 5 star all the way!

This is an amazing restaurant in downtown summerlin!! Love the open atmosphere enjoying dinner and looking out at the shops. The food is 5 star Italian with great dishes, favorites are chicken parmigiana, pesto gnocchi, and old fashioned spaghetti and meatballs. Bethany at the bar is an amazing server and will keep you entertained with great conversation and good company. This is my favorite spot for dinner go check it out for yourselves!!
Yummy food. Great for dinner before a movie. Pizza was amazing. Service exceptional.  Love meeting friends on the patio during spring and fall.

This is my favorite restaurant. Very kind and thoughtful waiters. The lasagna is the best in town. If you're coming for lunch, it's not on the menu. Ask for it, and they'll take care of you! Also, the chocolate chip cannoli will literally and figuratively save your life.

Not only good location great environment friendly staffed and the food excellent , one of the best Italian places I've eaten not only in Vegas but I'm glad they got this one in downtown Summerlin closer to my home. Definitely another one of my favorite restaurants.

Very good Italian food.  Had the pasta and clams and it was very good but at the high price paid I would have expected it to be a bit better.  Caesar salad was delicious but the croutons could crack a tooth!

Watch out! Our boss took 8 of us to dinner tonight. I was very much looking forward to eat a juicy steak. For $40 they gave me a salt meat!! It was so salty I had to force it down my throat and drink with each bite!! As my boss was paying for it and I was with my colleagues I did not say anything I just eat it all and stayed quiet .
I told the waiter Keith who was nice but I am not sure if he let the manager or the cook know about the salty steak! 
Just because they are in Summerlin in Vegas and charge $40 for a price of steak that does not guarantee a good quality food. Such a shame !!!
Great food and excellent service! Also, the patio is a really nice spot to relax and have a drink!

This is one of my favorite local spots to go to. Ricki the server and manager Dan are the most welcoming and dynamic team. I love their meatballs and they have the BEST Italian kale salad that is simply a must try!!! The service is always incredible and I can count on a yummy meal and delicious wine. It's definitely a great place to hang out for happy hour or enjoy a nice dinner!

The food was absolutely fantastic and the waitress was phenomenal in fact, she's the reason I didn't walk out. I ordered the chicken parmigiana (fantastic!) but it needed some spice, so I asked for the only hot sauce, Tabasco. They brought it to me in a [insert profanity of choice] cup! They were happy to give me a bottle of balsamic vinegar and olive oil but not Tabasco. As a Louisianan, I find that insulting and inexcusable. Tabasco must be spread with the original nozzle, not a [add profanity] cup. There's more traditional in that bottle than anything else in that restaurant. Fix or I shall not be a frequent guest.

I've been here several times and they continue to impress! With the customer service being top notch, and the bartender ( I think her name is Bethany) the food, atmosphere, and all the people are very friendly! The food is delicious and my fave is the lasagna!!! You cannot go wrong in here!

While I have always loved this restaurant, my last experience was a little underwhelming. I went to dinner there with a friend, and the service was not great. Our waiter was very nice and friendly  but seemed overwhelmed.  I actually had to ask for a drink refill twice as he never offered. At the end of the meal, he asked if we wanted  boxes for our leftovers, to which we agreed, then left, came back a second time and asked us again. The cherry on the cake was when a skinny, blonde hostess (who sounded also a little scattered)  inquired if I was someone's mother (who happens to be only 9 years younger than I. Clearly she did not get the memo that you never guess or assume a person's age. Not impressed and not sure I will be going back.

Very good Italian food and service. I had spaghetti and meatballs and others had ziti. Two kids (3 and 19 months - and the mess associated with them but the staff was great about that) shared ravioli off the kids menu. We dined outside in pleasant weather. Pricing is spot on for what you get. Highly recommended!

Pretty satisfied with this restaurant. I normally don't venture out to Summerlin, but a group of my friends wanted to meet up since it had been a while since we all saw each other. Although it was warm outside, we sat in the outer dinning area and felt fine. The fans kept us really cool and we were shielded from the sun. Every table gets free bread and a plate of olives, cheese and other little vegetables. I ordered the pesto gnocchi which was just okay. I'm allergic to dairy so it is often hard to find a good meal without cheese in it at Italian restaurants. I think next time I will try the spaghetti and meatballs. 

The prices are definitely high, so it's more of a place to celebrate a special occasion. Our waitress was super nice and patient with us. I would definitely go back for a date night

My husband, granddaughter an I came here for lunch an let me say it was great. Loved the gact you can sit inside or outside. From the moment you walk in the place you know your going to have great food an Excellent service. I had the grilled chicken Cesare salad which was oh the hook. The flavor of the chicken was very good an cooked perfectly.  My husband had the Philly cheese  steak minus peppers an mushrooms an it was also good. An my he spaghetti our granddaughter had was good as well. The garlic knots omg...yummmm...The manager checked every order before it went out to make sure everything was perfect. Our server checked backed often to make sure we were ok as well as the manager. We will definitely be going back. All the food even the pizza looked amazing. Can't wait to try it all.

After an hot Vegas afternoon of shopping my friend and I decided to stop for a salad and glass of wine.....so glad we passed on our original stop and tried something new.  We were promptly seated and waited on.  We ordered the peanut kale and caesar salad (added shrimp) and split a carafe of red sangria.  Everything was very fresh and well presented.  We really enjoyed the complimentary garlic knots.  Will be bringing more guests more often.
Great service, amazing food. I'm Italian and from NY. I would say hands down this is the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.

Went here for Valentine's Day on a second date.  The setup was not ideal for relaxing and getting to know someone.  The two tops are INCREDIBLY small and there were were surrounded on both sides by other two-tops, about 8-10 inches away.  I felt claustrophobic and it was uncomfortable to talk because the tables on each side of us could clearly listen in on our conversation. We might as well have all been at one big table together, that's how close we were. They need to spread things out a bit more if they want their ambiance to be better.  Stop trying to squeeze so many people in!  The food was pretty good, I told the waiter I wanted a pepperoni pizza and it came out smothered in kalamata olives and pepperoni ( I absolutely HATE olives!) Not sure why they did that...I did'nt want to complain in front of my date so I just picked them off but all I could taste was olives  :/  Pasta fagioli soup was decent, not the best I've had in the city.  Garlic knots were awesome.
Amazing food and absolutely loved the staff. Great portions of food and lots to choose from. I tried many dishes and deserts and I can't pick a favorite cause it was all delicious.
Had a great time this past weekend! Loved their new singer. Beautiful voice! I hope this will be a regular for the weekend. I'm still dreaming about my amazing pizza. Great addition to downtown

This is the real deal! We started with the Calamari and the Caprese Mozzarella. The calamari perfectly cook and the Mozzarella creamy and delicious.  I had the linguini with clams. The pasta perfectly cooked and the little neck clams overflowing!  My husband had the eggplant and pasta that was to die for!  Then on the to dessert!  We shared a piece of ricotta cheese cake that was smooth and tasty. One of the best I have had in a long time. We also had the cannoli that had great filling and a nice crunchy shell. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. It is definitely a place we will be coming back to time and time again!

Sucks! That was my overall experience! I am sorry! After we have been seated we waited about 10 minutes and no one came to greet us and to take orders!! What!!! We went around 1 PM on a Sunday and they were not even busy at all! I wonder how bad it could have been if they were actually busy! After 10 minutes here came this waitress who looked like just woke up from a nap or something. So unprofessional! She looked like she didn't want to be there!! Wow!! And the food sucked too!! Chicken was so burnt!!! Literally black! And tasted burned! Too small portions felt like its kid's meal or something!!! I will never ever go there again!!

My boyfriend and I just finished a late lunch at this restaurant and let me tell you.....it is now our new favorite place!!! We were completely blown away by the atmosphere and the excellent service we received. Our servers name was Heather*** (I'm sorry heather!) and she was terrific. We also got a chance to meet the restaurant Manager, Mimmo. He is one of the main reasons we will be returning to this restaurant, besides the tasty food, of course! Mimmo is from Rome, Italy and he makes you feel like part of the family. 

The atmosphere is outstanding. I absolutely love the layout of this cute little restaurant. The kitchen is open so you could see everything which is a really great touch. 

They bring free garlic knots to the table, which they are so soft and accented with Parmesan and Romano cheese. We decided to start off with some calamari as our appetizer. It was the best calamari I have ever had! It was so tender and perfect. So, compliments to the chef. 

For our entrees we ordered baked ravioli and baked ziti and those were excellent as well! I am completely impressed by this cute little restaurant and I will keep returning to enjoy their great food!

AMAZING Food and amazing service. Beautiful place, relaxing and delicious. Italiano at it's best. Next time I have to try the desert but the food was so good that I over ate. Worth every penny in my book.

Took a party of 3 around 8pm last night. Outdoor seating was perfect for the weather. Nice area to eat. However both hostesses were either completely new to the business or new to a customer service job. No smile .... No nothing ... Barking out seating times. The alcoholic drinks were great , the food was average. The server was good and made me feel like I was in New York. Accent attached!! Wouldn't recommend the lobster tortellini.... But the meatballs and spaghetti were great.  Overall .... Would return only in a pinch.

First time here and really enjoyed the food. Service was great but we sometimes waited a little bit for the waiter to return - it wasn't all that busy, but he was very attentive to each table and was wonderful otherwise.
I didn't realize the place was small inside, but that kept it quaint.
Definitely looking forward to going again.

Me and my wife go there once a week to have a couple of drinks, and a pizza.  The food is very good.  Bethany is a great bartender.  Recently they added live music, which, in my opinion makes the dining experience worse.  The musicians are pretty old, have way too much hair dye, and sing songs that attracts an older crowd.  The sad part is that after a while, the sixty-somethings begin to dance, and let everyone know how drunk they are.  Hopefully they can trim down the number of nights that they have live music.

The service was amazing here. We came here during their lunch time on a Sunday. They had a brunch menu, which was basically similar to their dinner menu but in a smaller portion. However, this portion was definitely not small at all. It just seemed like they served dinner portion food in a small plate. We ordered couple beers, and they were served in a cold icy glass, which we loved for a sunny Sunday afternoon. Also, we ordered their carbonara pasta with shrimp and Vongole. The linguine was cooked perfect, and so was the spaghetti. I love their shrimp for some reason, since they cook it so tender. 

Our server-I believe his name was Anthony- was friendly, attentive and caring. We found a random piece of thick thread in our vongole, but didn't really care. It was not a hair or anything. We killed the dish, and at the end of the meal, we told the server that the food was amazing-however, we still went ahead and told them about the little piece that we found so they could prevent it from happening to other customers-since some people do rage about nothing.

The manager came over to our table and apologized. I do not think it was their fault, since things like this can happen. He comped the pasta dish for us, which made us feel horrible. However, we left the amount as tip, and left very satisfied.

TIP! The Andes Mint Chocolates they give at the end of your meal are perfect dessert!

Love every aspect of this restaurant. I specially like this location better than venetian one. Definitely give it a try!
3 star Italian. Food and service was good. Bar was slow at getting drinks to the table. The live entertainment had a speaker that was cracking so it was distracting and we didn't stay for dessert.

We frequent this place. It's located in Downtown Summerlin and is next the the Regal 5. The eggplant appetizer is the best! We also like the pizza. Everything we have tried has been good. The service isn't the best but not bad enough to not go back.

We had a great meal last week.  Vegetables were cooked perfectly and the waiter, an older gentleman, was great with the kids.  Everyone's meal came out on time and was nice and hot.  Prices were fair.  We will be back again.

Loved it!! Great spot. We got a 50% off entree coupon at Tix4Today-- you spend $3/person to get the coupon, but it certainly helped us save. Garlic knots were to die for, penne vodka was some of the best I've had-- smooth and silky sauce dente pasta. The Caesar was a little over dressed, but the dressing was good so I can't complain. Nice service. 

The only thing I'd say is that for the Venetian the "views" aren't great. It's situated right near the food court adjacent to a gift shop. They did a nice job with the decor and adding some green shrubs to shield a bit. And the prices were very reasonable (all pastas were $15-$22, chicken parm $26, small Caesar $8) so for us the small tradeoff was worth it. 

We will definitely be back if we are in Vegas again!
Great spot!! To have dinner we shared the Ceasar salad , meat balls and baked ziti!! Delicious I'm just saying.

Amazing first experience here tonight. I brought an out-of-town guest so I was looking to make a good impression, it did not disappoint.  Danny was our server and Ricky worked along with him to make sure our drinks were never empty and we had everything else we needed. They brought a lovely plate of olives, cheese and peppers along with the MOST AMAZING garlic knots to munch on before our meal. I had the Chicken Parmesan; it's really tasty and the portions are huge! 
I will definitely come back. Thank you to Danny and Ricky for takin care of us ladies and making us feel welcome.

Wow! From the moment you walk in to this place you know you are going to eat real Italian food! The smells in here are stunning! The kitchen overlooks the dinning area so you can see your food being cooked right in front of you! Very cozy intimate spot, great for a date night and great food! Staff was excellent and took care of all our needs. I had the chicken parm, it was very tasty, chicken was juicy and not fried tasting. Red sauce is very Southern Italian, pizzas are big and flavorful. This will be a weekly spot to eat at! Finally real Italian food in Summerlin! Looking forward to trying other dishes!!! Yum!

Their food is very good. They provide a complimentary plate with cheese, olives and peppers for a small starter. After, they give garlic knots (which are only ok. Not the best I've ever had, but still yummy. Besides, they're free.) I ordered a pasta & a pizza. The baked ziti was FANTASTIC! I really enjoyed the sauce, and it's very very cheesy. I had the Salame Picante Pizza, which was also very good. The crust is really why it was fantastic. It's a thin crust pizza, but not super crispy and hard to eat. The olives are definitely fresh, italian olives. Unfortunately, the food does not make this place worth going to. For a 75 dollar dinner (for two people) I expect MUCH more. 

The reason I'm not giving it 4 or 5 stars is because of the atmosphere, lack of unprofessionalism, and the manager. Our server, who was from North Carolina, did well. No complaints there. My complaint is mostly in regards to the open kitchen and the manager, Dan, who truly does not care at all. With an open kitchen, you must teach your cooks how to behave. When I sit down in front of an open kitchen, I have zero desire to listen to the cooks personal music blasting from their phones. If you're gonna have an open kitchen, you should probably tell your cooks that if theres guests sitting four feet away, the music restaurant should suffice. 

Something else that was frustrating was having the football game on. I personally don't care that the football game was on - especially since it's the beginning of the season. What I do mind is when you allow your staff to walk around yelling "TOUCHDOWN!" Again, there are guests here. I paid 75 dollars to eat my dinner in a nice restaurant, not buffalo wild wings.

LASTLY, my biggest issue of all - the manager Dan. When I expressed my concerns, Dan just stood there. After about 30 seconds, he says "I'll address it." Not a "Im sorry. You're right, that's not acceptable." Nothing. I already paid my bill, I had zero intention of a comped item. But Dan is by far the most lack luster, uncaring manager ever. Perhaps Trattoria Regiano in Venetian holds their staff to a higher standard than this location.

In sum, If you're going to Downtown Summerlin and are looking for a nice meal - go anywhere else. You'll actually enjoy the atmosphere of Shake Shack better.

try this place, you won't be disappointed! lobster ravioli was amazing, meatballs and ziti were so darn delicious, pasta was cooked perfectly, complimentary garlic rolls and a mini charcuterie plate of olives roasted bell peppers and parmesan chunks are the details that make this Italian restaurant truly special. The service here is warm friendly and welcoming. I love this place!!!

Yelp found us a wonderful place for Father's Day dinner as we began a two week road trip. Service was EXCEPTIONAL! Hilda was sweet and attentive as were the bussers. She even brought a small cannoli to my husband for dessert.

Food was great! You start with a little appetizer dish of peppers, olives and parm cheese chunks along with the best garlic knots ever. Could have stopped there. So good! And Hilda brought MORE!! Swordfish Siciliana was delicious - tender, juicy approx 8oz piece was plenty to share with capers, olives and tomatoes. We shared it along with the eggplant pizza which had a crispy thin crust and sliced eggplant and riccota. Lovely. Kid had what looked to be house made tortellini. Can't tell you much more than they disappeared quickly. 

Wonderful experience in Vegas, away from the drama of the strip.

I'm a creature of habit. So when it's winter time in Vegas,  the intense craving of warmth draws me here biweekly until the ice thaws. My go-to order is meatballs, garlic knots, broccoli rabe, and pasta e fagioli. I'm pretty sure everything on the menu is good, but I can't risk ordering my go-to items. You have all your food group to feel good about your meal especially after good workout session. The atmosphere is beautiful with just the right amount of class but not stuffy. I picked up a togo order on a Thursday night once and it was bustling with life music. In Vegas, there's no shortage of Italian food, but this place has the right amount seasoning in all categories.

Come for the Garlic knots and complimentary antipasto plate...they are the best things offered here.
The location is great (next to movie theatre) and I can see why it would be a goto spot in Downtown Summerlin. The patio seating with live lounge music is a nice place to hang out during the weekend...make sure to place reservations. The singer will politely ask for your favorite songs but then play her own lol...it's her thing :)
A bottle of wine and great service from Sam and Daniel, the manager, plus the Garlic knots make this place worth revisiting.
The food is lackluster and overpriced but TR's crowd doesn't seem to mind.

Chicken Marsala, Veal Piccata  - Both very pedestrian. I think these dishes cater to the older crowd that doesn't like bold flavors but enjoys shuffle board. It reminded me of something I might get at a buffet. 

Overall, I wouldn't recommend TR to anyone that wants good Italian food or knows how to cook. But if you want ambiance and don't mind making a meal out of the Garlic knots, then this is your place!

Usuallly love this place but when you're #glutenfree and you order gluten-free food, even asking them to double check, send it back because it's not gluten free, get another one, eat it and then find out it wasn't gluten free #gonnabesick #glutenfreefail

Food was very very good!! Fast service, super cute and intimate place. Our servers name was Ricki, she was attentive and all. Although they couldn't figure out which tables were their own and what their rotation would be, and there was a little bit of bickering. Other wise they would have gotten 5 stars.

Very dissatisfied  about its food. I asked Chicken Marsala, not flavor!!   The lasagna and  meatballs/ too  . It's priced high  for the quality of food.  The location and ambience keep us there. But I would not recommended

I loved my meal at Trattoria Reggiano! I ordered the shrimp risotto and although the shrimp were a little tough, the risotto was absolutely delicious. The bread in the basket which came with the meal was soft and delightful. I really regretted leaving it behind, since we were traveling we couldn't take leftovers with us. My dining companion ordered the sea bass and loved it, it was prepared exactly the way he likes it. Our server was lovely and very attentive. I almost passed by this restaurant thinking a meal downtown would not be so great but I'm so glad we didn't. It turned out to be the best meal of our trip and I would highly recommend Trattoria Reggiano.

I'm giving this 3 stars only because of the bar service I have experienced on other occasions which was worth 5 stars... With that being said I would give dining on the patio 2 stars at best. First of all, when I ask about bread and water and the server responds with "the busser will bring that out soon" you've already rubbed me the wrong way. Which by the way she brought out 2 minutes later. 
The food is very mediocre and overpriced for what it is especially, with Grape Street being across the street at the same price and higher quality. 
I had the bolognese- average. The man had what seemed to be a chicken breast and dry pasta couldn't even tell you the name of the dish. 
We had to ask for our check and to-go boxes ourselves in an empty restaurant. 
Should've just cooked at home.

First,we love this place,the food is phenomenal. My wife, ordered wine instead got champagne. But it was taking forever just to get water and some bread. So she just went with it. So we had to ask the hostess for bread. Because Andres took FOREVER, We were there for almost 2 hours. Never asked how our food was, we had to ask for refills when we did see our waiter Andres. We also had to ask the hostess for our check then that took over 20 mins just to get that. We are so disappointed, our girls didn't even get the cannolis that they usually get after there meals. On a side note the food was great. We watched people leave because no one ever came over to at least get there drink order. I don't know if we will be back, this was our favorite for Italian but maybe have to loom somewhere else.

Trattoria Reggiano is my new favorite Italian restaurant. 

BEST SHRIMP SCAMPI EVER! They coated the shrimp with bread crumbs. The sauce was not greasy at all because it had a hint of fresh lemon juice. I devoured it! 

The meatballs were very juicy and the meat sauce was great. The meatballs are actually a mix of filet minion and pork. 

The spaghetti and meat sauce was great as usual. The noodles were cooked perfectly and the sauce complimented it very well. 

The atmosphere was great and I loved the live music during dinner time. The service was very good and our server made sure to ask us and the tables around how the food was. He also made sure to keep our water filled which I know is something minor but it shows they are paying attention to our table.

I had baked ziti & the wife ordered the meat balls. Ziti was good, nothing fantastic. Balls were ok. We had the balls at Little Tony's in Palace Station the week before & they were great. We'll try something else next time we're there & give them another chance.

A trattoria is an Italian-style eating establishment, less formal than a ristorante, but more formal than an osteria. There are generally no printed menus, the service is casual, wine is sold by the decanter rather than the bottle, prices are low, and the emphasis is on a steady clientele rather than on haute cuisine.

The above is Wikipedia's definition of a trattoria.  Some of it fits what we experienced at Downtown Summerlin Reggiano.  I'll start with the positive.  At the end of our ordeal Danny the manager refused our payment with apologies.  It would have been about $200. I did tip accordingly.

It was a birthday celebration and our small party of three chose to try something new that a trusted friend raved about, Trattoria Reggiano.  We had reservations and we were seated promptly.  But I should have guessed what was to come when our table, covered with the traditional sheet of meat wrapper, came with a can of crayons.  Our attentive server (Dan, not the manager) was prompt and pleasant. He brought menus which are printed with impossibly small print.  He took our drink orders (wine, martini and water) and soon returned with a basket of the wonderful garlic buns.  Fifteen minutes later, still no beverages.  

We were seated near the bar and I could see the person behaving like a bartender wondering about the trattoria, bussing tables and socializing with the foursome at the table next to ours.  I could also see Dan giving her furtive glances to see where the drink order was.  He feared returning to our table because he knew we would also ask.  In the meantime a woman brough her very young daughter to the bar area and said, "Wouldn't you like to sit on the stool that (famous Golden Knights hockey player) sat in the other night?"  Hey, isn't there a law prohibiting minors from sitting in a bar area?  As a bartender or manager I would be nervous about risking my permit over such an infraction, I don't care if you are the Duchess of Summerlin.

In the meantime the bussers would come around the corner with a load of dirty dishes, silverware and glasses which then would be unceremoniously dumped with an accompanying cacophony of disturbing noise.  I'm European and I can tell you that such behavior in Italy would have been the cause of immediate dismissal of that employee.

Finally, Dan came over, apologized for the slow cocktail service and pressed the barmaid to produce our order.  The water came first followed soon by the glass of wine and my martini.  I ordered a martini up.  It was in a stemmed glass, but it had ice cubes in it.  Hello?????  I passed it off as sloppy pouring and said nothing.

By this time we had put in our entree order and waited...and waited...and waited.  I ordered another martini.  It was served identically only with more ice cubes.  Not the way I have ever had a chocolate espresso martini.

More than an hour after entering the premises it occurred to me that the can of crayons were there to help pass the time.  Maybe some doodling, hangman, anything to take our minds of our growling tummies.  I must say that the food is prepared in generous proportions.  Our order included a Caesar Salad and Dan advised wisely, that one order would feed two and offered to split it on two plates.  It came on one and we did the honors.  My pasta dish with meatballs lasted two additional meals after take out.  The food was slightly on the bland side.

In the meantime, I observed Dan and the other working server (only two for the whole place).  He was quite industrious working his tables but the holdup in the kitchen made that a challenge.  His serving associate however, was another story.  She would disappear for lengthy periods.  Twice I watched her go out the front door to talk on her cell phone while customers were waiting for service.  I'm assuming she was mining for another job.

After nearly two hours we just wanted to get out of there and none of us finished our food.  Took awhile to wave down Dan for the check and the to go containers.  He apologized for the slow service and we acknowledged his apology by briefly expressing our disappointment.  He asked if "The Birthday Boy" would be interested in a dessert.  This was the fourth time he used that moniker with me and my 71-year-old child within was about ready to bop him one.  I just said, "no".

Soon after Danny the manager came back with our check and  acknowledging that they had staffing issues.  He assured me when I asked that my drinks should not have been served over ice.  When it was obvious that even when offered a free meal we would never be back, he withdrew the check.  Kudos to him.  There are too many good places in this town to put up with that kind of service.

This restaurant is located at the Summerlin mall which makes it a very convenient location after a long day of shopping. In the summer time the ambiance is even better as you can sit on the outside patio. The price point is reasonable, you can find several dishes priced from 18 to 40 dollars per plate. 

They also have a large selection of items so there is not an issue finding anything you would like. The size portions were very generous, I would say most people would have a hard time finishing their plate. I ordered the Lobster Ravioli which was very good. There were large pieces of lobster all over the dish. The sauce was tasty and the ravioli was perfectly cooked. 

If you are looking for a simple but tasty dish I would recommend this dish. Overall, the food was good but not memorable.

My friend and I came here after a day of shopping, it was the first time for both of us. We had a wonderful server by the name of Ricki - we weren't sure what to order and she recommended the lobster ravioli which was what we both ordered and it was fantastic. We then had to have some dessert and our server Ricki recommended her favorite- tiramisu- well now it is my favorite!! So glad we decided to check out this place - will definitely be returning when Ricki is working and asking for her recommendations again!

This restaurant was soo good. Just randomly stopped in and it was Amazing! My sister and I got salmon and arugula salad (best salad I have ever had) and Shrimp scampi and we shared both. The linguine and sauce were so good. The sauce was light so it did not feel heavy like an Alfredo sauce. The shrimp was not cooked that well and that's the only reason I did not give it 5 stars. It was super crowded but the service was still great. Never had an empty drink which is a big plus. My daughter had spaghetti and she could not e happier.

First time here. Amazing food and Bethany at the bar is awesome! Great service and food recommendations. There was a live musician on guitar who was amazing. My wife and I are still here having a wonderful night. Thank you trattoria reggianno!

Celebrated my birthday with a friend.  It was my first visit.  I am a fan.  We shared a pizza, it was a very generous in size.  And very tasty!  But, what I really want to rave about is the service  we received from everyone.  The server, the bartender, the host were outstanding.

They have a lovely outside seating area with coolers so we were not hot at all.  A big thumbs up, can't wait to go back again.

We've been to Trattoria three times recently and have been so happy every time! The food is amazing and the staff is super friendly and really helpful! Plus the restaurant is nice and the patio is nice as well. 
I called on the phone to make a reservation and Angie was really nice and kind, and when we went in, she was just as sweet in person when she was greeting the guests and seating them. The manager Daniel was very, very nice and friendly as well. Our servers were great and very helpful (I have a food allergy so I had some questions), and I really appreciated it! 
We can't wait to go back again! :)

Had a wonderful lunch this afternoon!!! After a dietary concern, our waitress said she'd speak with the manager to see if they could accommodate us. Daniel the manager was very happy to oblige!! The food was excellent and we ate it before thinking to take a picture. My friend had a lemon something martini, which was excellent, and a kale peanut salad. I had chicken parmesan. Daniel checked on us several times to make sure everything was just right. The ambience was quaint, the staff friendly and personable and the food very good.  Excellent place for a date night or a casual girls afternoon outing!

The service was excellent.   Rikki did a great job.

Started with Eggplant Rolotini.  Moved on to Pasta Fagioli.   Both excellent

Veal Marsala for the entrees.  Very tender and generous portions of pasta.

Ricotta Cheesecake and Cannoli for dessert. Again. Very fresh and delicious.

Very impressed.  Will return.

This is high end for the mall restaurants here, but the nice decor and friendly staff outweigh the food and service. Unfortunately, it's one of those places where they notice your water glass is empty and refill it after you finish your meal and drank 3/4 of the water from the person next to you. 

My friend kept trying to ask the server questions and ordering but the server kept walking off where she was getting pretty frustrated. The place was 3/4 full maybe but not overly busy as it was already 7:30.

The whole table heard me ask for shrimp scampi since they had to come back to take my order, except our server so when the food came out I stared at it and thought these are either mighty big shrimp (the menu did say jumbo shrimp) or I got chicken. I ask the server to double check and said server apologized and insisted in making it right. It came out in 6 min. It was fast. I got 6 jumbo shrimp...maybe I should've told them to take their time and cook it for 12 minutes (to get 12 shrimp).

Shrimp was fine but it was overpowered by this stuffing placed on top which was salty and totally out of place. The shrimp was simply overpowered in this case.

The appetizers of calamari and cheese and olives were very good though. The mozzarella pizza was ok but it certainly is no Grimaldis or even Pieology. Yes, I would gladly take the pieology pizza. The pizza is thin slice but the tomato flavor is not there. It can use more sauce or tomato paste. The next day when I reheated it it was soggy due to to much water from the cheese. The lobster ravioli was very good.

It does not stack up against the middle ground Cheesecake Factory in my view. The service is friendly but lacking. For $300 for a group of 7 (not including the bar tab) it was nothing to write home about. Very disappointed as the place looked like a really nice place.

To start let me say we found our new local favorite!  We recently found this little gem after seeing a movie at Downtown Summerlin.  We plan on visiting for dinner prior to our future date night at the movies.  The restaurant is literally right next door to the theater.  Service is top notch!  We started with a drink at the bar so we would have a chance to look at the menu.  The bartender was very gracious and answered our questions about their specialty drinks and wines.  After looking at the menu we decided to have dinner and were promptly seated.  Our waiter was right there to greet us and answered our menu questions.  He also asked if we were seeing a movie so he could time our dinner if necessary.  I ordered my fave, eggplant parm which was awesome.  Perfectly cooked and not loaded with cheese.  My better half had a kale salad which was actually very good.  I rarely order healthy dishes but may rethink this as the salad had a great dressing and was a nice change from the standard caesar.  The manager Vito stopped by twice to check in on us and offered us a complimentary plate of olives and cheese which was a nice touch which you rarely see these days.  My only complaint is the lack of restrooms.  They only have one unisex restroom which is located in a busy hallway so it was bit awkward with a couple of us waiting in line.  I have already recommended it to friends so I would give it try.  You will not be disappointed.

We had a great waiter I didn't catch his name but we had the manager just make our restaurant dining experience so nice his name was Ben Martinez food was good liked everything except the Ceaser salad.

Got food poisoning there last night. Have eaten there before and thought the food was so-so, but never expected to get food poisoning. Threw up 4 times. Had eaten the salmon. Definitely will not be going back. A friend of mine told me her husband got sick there as well. They really need to change what they're doing. The place lacks a "uniqueness vibe" and the food is not commensurate with the prices. Out of all the places to go and eat, I can't imagine they'll survive with the quality they're producing.

Hilda our server was on point and knowable of the wine list. Spaghetti with meatballs was perfectly hot. Red sauce was just about perfect and not a mushroom in site,bits of garlic and see through onions. The wine was Bon Anno, Nappa Valley price at $50.00 a bottle. Antipasto, roasted and marinated red, yellow bell peppers,olives green,red and black and perfect hard cheese. The bread was a type of hard roll pretzel type. It did lack butter in the baking process. The double dark chocalate cake was perfect not overly sweet. Coffee was average but doable. I would have gave a 5 stars but the rolls bread gave it a 4.

This place gets a solid 5 stars. Excellent setting, both times I've been there's live music, and he's actually good. They have these fucking off the hook garlic knots that are literally the best things ever, THAT THEY GIVE YOU FOR FREE. The food, while some may be a tad expensive, is amazing in every aspect; presentation, taste, freshness, etc...

And honestly, the absolute best part, is the service. The waiters are the fucking shit. Dined last night with Hilda, I believe, and she's amazing. Super accommodating, I'm an asshole that modifies everything, and she had an answer for every question I had.

Believe the hype. Way dank.

Cute Italian restaurant in downtown Summerlin. I believe there is a location on the strip as well but I like this location better.

It has outdoor seating but since it's winter we opted to sit inside. There is a bar inside and as well as an open kitchen.

I started with a glass of wine. The waiter was very helpful in picking a glass of wine. I told him I was ordering penne al vodka and he suggested a red pinot. It was a great pairing! The pasta was also good.

Dessert was, of course, my favorite. We ordered tiramisu and it was the best tiramisu I have ever had. If you order dessert you must try this one.

The prices were moderate. Not overly expensive but not cheap. The service was good but we did have to wait a little while at the end of the check. Overall a good experience. My pick for best Italian in downtown Summerlin.

Wonderful evening !  Food was delicious, steamed clams, eggplant parm, fettuccine, chicken Marsala. Rosanna, Friday's entertainment, WONDERFUL. upcoming, Diana Krall, Michael Buble style.  Casual yet very special evening. Outdoor eating, fabulous weather. PERFECT EVENING.

One of my favorite places to eat at Downtown Summerlin. Its by Regal and Dave & Busters. It's great for a simple date spot... nice little outside area. The garlic knots and calamari are really good. I keep it simple with the personal pizzas, like the margherita and bruschetta. Always great food and service!

overprice and mediocre.Servers were pleasant but not very knowledgeable about Italinan food or wine.We asked several about Italian wines and no one knew what we were talking about .Very surprised they dont hire more experienced  service personal..some Italians!

Probably the best chicken and vegetables in town. You know what I'm talking about once you take your first bite. I always sit at the bar since the bartender is like 10 across the board with her service and personality. Amazing singers as well Wednesday through Saturday.

I love this place..Authentic Italian.  Everything is so fresh..Rickie is an amazing server.  She is one of the reasons we keep coming back..try the Eggplant Rottini as an appetizer.  Great happy hour too....

The food is great but the service needs much improvement. The staff is friendly but need some training to be more attentive. Not enough menus for all guests, water refills are few and far in between, it took a while to figure out who our server was.

The food was fine but the service was horrible! We arrived at 6:30pm on a Thursday night and the place was totally empty. We were just trying to grab a quick bite before our movie at 7:45pm next door. 

Our server Zekke was awful. The second we said we didn't want to order any drinks he lost all interest. I know that's where restaurants make money but it's not like we were taking a table away from other guests with a higher check. There was probably only 4 tables the entire time we were there. It took 35 minutes to just get a salad and another 20 for the pizza. When the pizza finally came out our server tried to give us tiny bread plates to eat off of. When I asked for a normal sized plate, he rolled his eyes and walked away. I honestly couldn't believe how rude he was! 

We left and mentioned to the hostess how horrible the service was but honestly I don't think anyone in that place cared. We won't be back.

Great atmosphere here. We sat outside, they had warmers so it was perfect. They had a guy on a keyboard and another singing, they were awesome. Our server was great. I ordered a cheeseless pizza and she asked if there's was an allergy they needed to know about, which I thought was awesome that she asked. My friend ordered a pasta dish that looked and smelled amazing, but my pizza was awful. Usually when you order something with capers, they're just kinda sprinkled on, but this was like an entire jar of capers had been dumped on the pizza. That was the only thing you tasted. The crust had no flavor, the mushrooms had no flavor, the sauce was barely visible.  The crust was hard and flat, it was like a cracker. I couldn't cut it with a knife, and it was difficult to pick up to eat. But both the pizza and the pasta dish were huge portions and everyone was super friendly so I would recommend this place, just not the pizza.

We ate here yesterday and was presently surprised at how good it was.  We ordered the bucatini carbonara, linguine with clams and the eggplant parmesan and all were excellent and large portions.  The garlic bread was great but I would just prefer the choice of just plain old  Italian bread.  The balsamic vinegar and olive oil was good but I asked for butter which was brought quickly. Our server Zeki was professional, attentive and polite.  We were also given a dish of olives, red peppers and hard parmesan cheese to our delight.  We will try it again soon.

We went to this joint recently and I'm on the fence. I've heard nothing but great things from the one on the strip. This one is much closer to home. 

Service: Our waiter was Jason. The poor guy seemed so stressed and the entire restaurant seemed understaffed. First downside. Jason was great though. Even though he seemed rushed, he was very attentive and quick to make sure our drinks were filled and our food came out in a very timely manner. 
His manager or whomever the older gentleman was at the window for food was not. He kept yelling out at the waiters. Which I felt was insanely unprofessional because that window is right next to tables. This is a very open restaurant and you can see all of the cooking staff. 
There was a time that Jason was taking our order and the manager yelled out "Jason! Order up!" And Jason kind of glanced over at him to show him that he was in the middle of taking our order. 
Who does this? I don't know. But I hope he sees this and realizes that it makes him look horrible and the restaurant in general. 
Also, hire more people or staff appropriately. We went during prime time, 7:30ish. You should be fully staffed. Otherwise, you have a bunch of waiters running around trying to serve a ridiculous amount of tables and people are going to start to get frustrated. 

Food: I wasn't really that impressed. The calamari was good, but a bit too peppery. The marinara was very good and very flavorful. We also had the lobster ravioli and the lasagna. 
Ravioli...it was good. It was probably my favorite dish. But the lasagna kind of lacked in flavor. It was very mediocre and pretty plain. Which in my experiences in Las Vegas, it's all roughly the same for lasagna for some odd reason. 

The restaurant itself isn't very large. They have a nice sized patio if you want to dine outside and they do have a nice selection of wines. The best was they have a nice description of what the wine is, so that is very helpful. We had the Barbera D'Asti. I highly recommend if you like red full bodied wines. 
The prices we reasonable as well. 

Overall, I'm sure I'll go back to try other dishes. It's a nice location and another good addition to the Summerlin Downton Mall.

Service is absolutely excellent. However, the food was really really salty. I wish I had sent the carbonara back, but I was really enjoying my anniversary. They did however send a nice complimentary cannoli for our anniversary per our reservation notes. I was thankful of that for sure. Food is a little for the quality.

OMG Omg authentic Italian food. U must go here, this is the best Italian food I've ever had. Everything is made fresh to order, even the pasta!!! I will definitely be back. Everything on the menu is amazing and a party in my mouth!!!

The food was mediocre and overpriced. I had a four cheese pizza. I have tasted better in other less expensive restaurants.  The service was meh. The guy pushed the higher cost menu items even after we refused.
Also we went fairly early for the dinner rush and they were already out of salmon and truffle. It is disappointing that they were already out of main ingredients for the dishes we truly wanted to get.
I will admit I liked seeing Copa America on the TV, but that isn't enough to make me want to try this place again.

Place is beautiful, no doubt.
$16.00 for the Kale Chicken Salad is too pricey for lunch.
The pizza looked great but I have to say the tomato sauce was very bland and had no flavor.
I had to salt the pizza.
Came here for some drinks and a appetizer before a movie.  Really enjoyed it here and we will be back.

I love the ambiance and the delicious food! From the garlic knots to the chicken Parmesan, everything was perfection! Make sure to try the chicken tortellini it's my favorite! And don forget the dessert, from cheesecake to cannolis don't end the night without trying one of their signature desserts! I'll recommend this restaurant to all of my friends and family.
This place was Great! The food was excellent, Bethany was great. Would happily recommend this place to everyone.

Awesome, awesome!!! Truth be told I already cooked dinner for myself and my other half tonight, yet I found myself stuffing my face with delicious meatballs! We were out and about shopping and my BF wanted something sweet, I was in support of a restaurant so I could have a glass of wine. The restaurant is very intimate, which I love!! They offer outdoor seating, another plus, plus a great happy hour. We decided to share the spaghetti and meatballs and let me tell you, hands down best meatballs in Vegas. My BF grew up in a very strict Italian family and he could not stop talking about how great the meatballs are. We have no desire to go to another Italian restaurant in Vegas. We of course got our something sweet in the end where my BF chose the Carrot Cake and I went for the Cannoli. Both were amazing!!!! Danny G. the manager helped me to decide to order the Cannoli since he was bragging about how good it is and that they make it fresh in house, SOLD!!! Danny G. was a delight who went over and beyond any expectations to make a casual stroll into dinner #2. Thank you all for a fabulous time!!

We went to grape street in January and let me just say you have it all over them. Our waitress Teressa was wonderful and Mimmo is my new favorite person very classy. The food was absolutely amazing. The garlic knots with the oil and vinegar just wow I couldn't stop eating them. I ordered one of their signature drinks it was delicious we went during lunch time and had the balsamic chicken salad. And also one of their pizzas. I cannot wait to go back for dinner! This is a must place to eat!

Best food and staff in town hands down!  I am gluten free and they accommodated everything amazingly and made me feel so comfortable.  The bartender Bethany took time to make sure she had everything right and was so helpful and an absolute pleasure to be around. The GM Wendy and the manager Daniel were accessible to everyone in the restaurant and were so courteous, they immediately make you feel like you are part of a big Italian family, which I actually am! First time here but 100% not the last. Thank you so much for an amazing experience.

The Caprese appetizer isnt something traditional but the cheese was delicious. The tortelloni alfredo was good. The waiter checked on us periodically and they brought a complimentary veggie/cheese dish which was ok. The garlic bread was never replenished that was given in the beginning. The calamari smelled awful - too fishy. I wanted meat with my dish and they couldnt add it for extra. I had to buy meat balls on the side just to pair it with something. My friend's spaghetti and meat balls were plain sauce wise and my other friend's white wine pasta dish was not appetizing at all. Ended up spending almost $200 between the 3 of us. There was definitely nothing special about this place. I dont mind spending good money on quality italian but I think its more hype than anything else. Overall mediocre. I dont think Id come back again. Im usually not a complainer/nit picker but for someone who loves Italian food and doesnt mind forking out the money it was a big let down.

Absolutely one of the best dinners ever.  Food was prepared perfect. Appetizers were Calimary with marinara sauce and a Caprese Salad, stunning.  I ordered the Shrimp Linguini Marinara with crisp golden French Fries and the wife had USDA NY Steak with Vegetables.  Steak was a beautiful medium rare; vegetables were crisp clean and sautéed perfectly. On to dessert... Tiramisu, Ricotta Cheese Cake, Lemon Sorbet and Gelato... wonderful and an absolute symphony of flavor. You know all the ingrediants, foods and sauces were prepared fresh and with passion.

 I would like to compliment the Chef, kitchen staff, servers and Management for outstanding food and service. I will be back with family for sure.

We went to the restaurant at the Venetian this time and it was sooooo good! The service provided by Santina was attentive and well provided. They have a great wine list, a bit pricey by the glass but good. We had the calamari for the appetizer and it was breaded lightly and tasty. We had the eggplant and chicken parmigiana both had pasta and were prepared flawlessly. I highly recommend this restaurant

Love this place! My favorite restaurant for the past year as I am very picky about my pasta but every pasta dish here is to die for! Best waiter is Mimmo, he's wonderful and sweet and attentive. Everyone I bring loves it. And the live music is very enjoyable. Especially sitting outside just enhances the experience, beautiful restaurant and mall to shop at after!

Today they just opened. We tried the soup , meatballs, chicken melanesse and eggplant rolatini. The eggplant is a must and all the food was excellent. So glad that they are here in downtown summerlin. This will be a regular for us. Welcome to the neighborhood! Staff is wonderful  and love the interior.

VISUAL AESTHETIC: 3/5
Trattoria Reggiano is located within Downtown Summerlin, right beside the Regal Cinemas. The sign is properly displayed and easy to find, while the parking lot is also convenient and just steps away from the restaurant itself. 

This can be positive or negative, depending on the party dining, but the restaurant is coddled between the theatre and an adjacent restaurant while across the way is a set of buildings. Although this is the layout of the shopping center, the wall creates a short of "block" in the space for the outdoor patio seating. 

The seating arrangement outdoors and indoors is quite small, and the bar has a wall that slices through it which divides the visible advantage of space. Tables are covered with a paper and have a cup of Crayons which offers a "family friendly" aspect for those that have children. 

Overall, the atmosphere is average. The dining decor is comfortable, and the level of noise is also average.

FOOD: 1/5
It was my first time dining here. The reviews drew my mom and I to this restaurant and we decided to celebrate my birthday here. We wanted to take our time ordering as we expected to eat and drink for a prolonged period.
